The MagSafe Charger makes wireless charging a snap for your iPhone 12 or iPhone 12 Pro and provides the optimal performance in wireless charging up to 15W
column2: But something is still missing: A powerful sidekick to boost up its full potential.

column1: There are cases or stands for the MagSafe Charger in the market, but none of them is like RimFo which is born to take your MagSafe Charger to the next level.
RimFo is the only one of its kind. Its innovative design turns the case into a dual shafts stand rather than simply adds a stand to a case. It is a game-changing product.

RimFo transforms the rim of the case into dual shafts structure. This unique and patented design can elevate the MagSafe Charger to a suitable height with a comfortable charging angle for you to charge your iPhone 12.
RimFo armors up your MagSafe charger, and gives you a brand new way of using your MagSafe charger.
RimFo transforms into a stand when you need it, and folds into a shock proof case when you are done.

Created with our patented rim-folded design, RimFo is made of three main parts which are exquisite design to achieve adjustable height and angle for your MagSafe Charger while remaining in such slim size.

With RimFo, the MagSafe charger will firmly adsorb your iPhone 12 in portrait mode or landscape mode. It promises you with a perfect viewing position by adjusting angle and height. This hands-free charging experience extends your productivity especially in scenarios of charging your iPhone 12 while working.
By adjusting the iPhone camera to your good angle, Show your best look in webcasting, video meeting or facing time,  yet no worry about powering off.
Adjust phone screen to your comfortable posture while browsing, swiping or video watching, still no worry about running out of battery.
With RimFo, you can stick your MagSafe charger to your magnetic car mount for a quick charge, and hit the road.

With our innovative and patented design, RimFo is engineered without the ugly bulk to be incredibly slim. The RimFo is ONLY 6.9mm in height, 65mm in diameter. It fits your pockets or bags effortlessly.
With RimFo, MagSafe Charger can float-charge iPhone 12  all series from mini to max.
Installing your Magsafe Charger in RimFo is simple and easy. In 2 steps, Magsafe Charger is attached securely and ready to rock!
Catching eyeballs by  simply taking out the one and only RimFo, enjoying the brand new charging experience with your MagSafe Charger anywhere you go.
The prototypes show in this campaign are made of aluminum alloy by CNC machine. The rewards we will send to you would be made of zinc alloy with electroplating.
We will provide one color for start - charcoal grey.

The MagSafe Charger makes wireless charging a snap for iPhone 12 series, it is thin and portable. There are many protective cases and stands for MageSafe Charger in the market, yet none of them can fully boost up its full potential. We want a case&
column2: stand which is as slim and portable as MagSafe Charger itself.

column1: From then on, we began shaping the product in our mind. One day, an idea hits us: a foldable stand that can transfer into a case, or vice versa! What left for us to figure out is that how to make it slim and portable. Since then, we have put a lot of time and effort to come up with the rim-folded design.
We used 3D printing and CNC machining for prototyping. We adjusted, 3D printed, and adjusted again- for dozens of iterations before we achieve the final design.

Actually there are more than twice prototyping before we achieved the final design. We only list the major modifications in our prototyping. The first prototype has limited angles adjustment and instability when it unfolded as a stand, so we redesigned the three main parts by reducing the weight of the upper parts and slightly increasing the weight of the base, yet still it did not meet our goals, also another problem caught our attention: we find it a bit slippery on smooth surface.

The rewards we deliver to you will be based on the final prototype, we innovatively improved instability by increasing half of the upper part to the base which also gives us enough space to install silicone pads to avoid slippery in the meantime.
We are thrilled that we can solve the problems and remain in such slim size in our final design!
","The MagSafe Charger makes wireless charging a snap for your iPhone 12 or iPhone 12 Pro and provides the optimal performance in wireless charging up to 15W
column2: But something is still missing: A powerful sidekick to boost up its full potential.

column1: There are cases or stands for the MagSafe Charger in the market, but none of them is like RimFo which is born to take your MagSafe Charger to the next level.
RimFo is the only one of its kind. Its innovative design turns the case into a dual shafts stand rather than simply adds a stand to a case. It is a game-changing product.

RimFo transforms the rim of the case into dual shafts structure. This unique and patented design can elevate the MagSafe Charger to a suitable height with a comfortable charging angle for you to charge your iPhone 12.
RimFo armors up your MagSafe charger, and gives you a brand new way of using your MagSafe charger.
RimFo transforms into a stand when you need it, and folds into a shock proof case when you are done.

Created with our patented rim-folded design, RimFo is made of three main parts which are exquisite design to achieve adjustable height and angle for your MagSafe Charger while remaining in such slim size.

With RimFo, the MagSafe charger will firmly adsorb your iPhone 12 in portrait mode or landscape mode. It promises you with a perfect viewing position by adjusting angle and height. This hands-free charging experience extends your productivity especially in scenarios of charging your iPhone 12 while working.
By adjusting the iPhone camera to your good angle, Show your best look in webcasting, video meeting or facing time,  yet no worry about powering off.
Adjust phone screen to your comfortable posture while browsing, swiping or video watching, still no worry about running out of battery.
With RimFo, you can stick your MagSafe charger to your magnetic car mount for a quick charge, and hit the road.

With our innovative and patented design, RimFo is engineered without the ugly bulk to be incredibly slim. The RimFo is ONLY 6.9mm in height, 65mm in diameter. It fits your pockets or bags effortlessly.
With RimFo, MagSafe Charger can float-charge iPhone 12  all series from mini to max.
Installing your Magsafe Charger in RimFo is simple and easy. In 2 steps, Magsafe Charger is attached securely and ready to rock!
Catching eyeballs by  simply taking out the one and only RimFo, enjoying the brand new charging experience with your MagSafe Charger anywhere you go.
The prototypes show in this campaign are made of aluminum alloy by CNC machine. The rewards we will send to you would be made of zinc alloy with electroplating.

RECON is a portable foldable Bluetooth mouse. With its unique design inspired by the human spine, RECON has the full functionalities of a mouse, together with a compact space-saving design. RECON is built with a high storage Li-ion battery and features a design that fits perfectly in your pocket and bags. By utilizing a Bluetooth 4.0 connection, you'll also free up a valuable USB port. 

Key features of RECON:
• A 400 mAh rechargeable Li-ion battery with a micro-USB charging port
• Four different DPI level (up to 2400DPI) to adjust the resolution to your task

Design

RECON design is inspired by the human spine and has a reconfigurable body.RECON has more flexible choices on both the appearance and functionalities compared with normal shaped mice.


A switch embedded on the RECON's keel automatically turns the device on while bending and off while straightening. This unique mechanism bends in only one direction at a time.

In addition, the mouse can bend by 180 degrees while supporting your thumb and ring finger entirely.

Taking a mouse travelling is often difficult because of weight and size concerns. With a thickness of just 9 millimetres, RECON changes the pattern of the mouse design.RECON is flat when not in use and comfortably fits in your bag or pocket.

The direct Bluetooth 4.0 connection can save one of your valuable USB ports. Nowadays Bluetooth connection is a widely diffused built in feature, so why doesn't make the best of it? RECON is compatible with Mac OS, Microsoft-based PC's, Android based tablets, and more.
With the built-in 400 mAh li-ion battery, RECON's durability is fantastic. One full charge can withstand one month of use. RECON's touch scroll is sensitive and comfortable to control.

In addition, RECON can switch its DPI resolution by holding the left and right buttons together for three seconds making RECON suitable for a wide range of scenarios, whether you are using it for designing, gaming or daily usage.

Our portable smartphone stand is an additional bonus to say thank you for your support to our campaign. It’s simple, light-weight, and useful. It frees your hand while reading articles and watching videos on your smartphone. Our foldable stand is like a piece of paper that you could easily carry everywhere.

We have a balanced design and technical team working on the development of RECON. The developers all have strong background on mechanics and electronics. The previous version of RECON works well and is publicly praised. With this new version, we introduced a Bluetooth connection to enhance even more the portability of our mouse. The production schedule and plan have been fixed and we already have a solid base of manufacturers and suppliers for creating the best mouse ever. We are confident to deliver our RECON product to our backers on time.

Our company, MJ Technology, has a mission to bring innovative, high quality hardware and software to the market at an increased value for you the consumer.  Led by our two company founders, we are a team of eight developers/engineers who have a combined knowledge base of over 50 years in the mobile technology fields. Our company has already brought one product to the market, our MJ7HDTV Android HDTV Tuner tablet, so we have the experience of designing, testing, and bringing to market a complete product.
column2:
>

Our plan now is to bring to the world market a tablet specifically designed and tailored for the openSUSE Leap operating system, not only for use by the avid Linux user, but also for the everyday user, thus bringing the benefits of Linux to people around the world.

Our goal is to make a superior tablet, both in build quality and hardware performance. This lets consumers then decide how they can utilize it to their best advantage. Whether that is a dual boot Windows 10/openSUSE Leap Distribution for a system administrator needing to manage multiple servers remotely, or just openSUSE Leap as your sole operating system for personal use, we have a tablet that will fit all of your needs.

The preinstalled image on the Warrior Tablet Series will be GNOME on openSUSE Leap, but users are welcome to change/reinstall/use Tumbleweed/etc. Any hardware support will be upstream via OBS, therefore will not impede different usage patterns. No lock-in here you the user have the choice always.

We are seeking $100,000.00 for the factory start-up and initial tooling costs to help bring this tablet design to the world market. We are ready to move forward with final production at this point, and are asking for your support, to help us make the World’s First actual Made-for- Linux x86/x64 Tablet a reality.

We want the user to have the choice of what operating system and software they want for their given application. Even if a user would like multiple operating systems on one tablet, such as openSUSE Linux Distribution or any other OS you can dream of, we can provide the user with the options they need.
column3:
>

openSUSE is one of the mostly widely used and recognized consumer and enterprise oriented Linux distributions to date, therefore it was the most logical choice to start our tablet development with. This allows the user immediate access to the hundreds of thousands of applications/games already available on Linux.
column4:
>

MJ Technology presents our ""Warrior"" series of Tablets. Pledge for one today here on IndieGoGo and join ""The Way of the Enlightened Warrior."" Please take a moment to review the specifications below of each model in our Tablet series, and begin your journey on the enlightened path.
column8:
>

If you want to see more details and bigger pictures please follow this link:
column10:
type=3

The pre-installed image on the Warrior Tablet Series will be GNOME on openSUSE Leap, but users are welcome to change/reinstall/use Tumbleweed/etc. Any hardware support will be upstream via OBS.

Some people will ask  “What does using Linux as your operating system provide you, the user, over other operating systems”?
column11:
>

Linux provides multiple advantages:

Cost – The most obvious advantage of using Linux is the fact that it is free, to obtain and use, while Microsoft and other products are available for a hefty, and sometimes, recurring fee. Microsoft licensed software is typically only allowed to be installed on a single computer, where as a Linux distribution and the related software can be installed on any number of computers, without paying a single dime.

Security – In line with the costs advantage, the system security aspects of Linux is much stronger and robust than that of Windows. Why should you have to spend extra money for anti-virus protection software, taking up CPU time, memory, and disk space?

The Linux operating system has been around since the early nineties and has managed to stay secure in the face of widespread viruses, spyware and adware for all these years. It is modeled after UNIX software, which is run around the world in multiple business and universities, and was designed from the beginning with security as a prime function.

While the argument has been made by some that Linux not being widely used compared to other operating systems is a reason for there being few known viruses able to attach it, it is more the way Linux is constructed internally that precludes easy infection and spread of computer viruses.

The Linux operating system is open source and if there were a widespread Linux virus released today, there would be patches released in a matter of hours or a few days, either by ordinary people that use the operating system or by the distribution maintainers. You wouldn’t need to wait for a patch from a single company like we do with some operating systems that could take weeks or months maybe possibly years in some cases.

Choice (Freedom) – The power of choice is a great Linux advantage. With Linux, you have the power to control just about every aspect of the operating system. Two major features the user can control are the look and feel of their desktop by way of numerous Window Managers, and the kernel, which controls the computer hardware. In Windows, you’re either stuck using the boring default desktop themes, or risk possible corruption or failure by installing a third-party shell. By controlling the kernel, the user can fine-tune their system for the way they work, not relying on a generic, one-size fits all usage pattern.

Software - There are so many software choices when it comes to doing any specific task, be it system admin, multi-media creation, education, you name it. If you need a specific program, you will probably find one or more that will work for you. You could search for a basic text editor from multiple sources at once, and yield hundreds, if not thousands of results.

Regular users and programmers contribute applications all the time. Sometimes it’s a simple modification or feature enhancement of an already existing piece of software, sometimes it’s a brand new application. In addition, software on Linux tends to be packed with more features and greater usability than software on Windows.

Best of all, the vast majority of Linux software is free and open source. Not only are you getting the software at no charge to you, but if you have a problem or an idea for an improvement, you can make a request to the software developers directly for them to make the changes. Another option, if you understand the programming language, is you, the end-user can modify the source code yourself and add more functions or fix problems. By contributing your changes to the source code back to the Linux community, you are improving the software for everyone.

 

What more could you, the user, ask for?

See our Facebook page as we will be posting continuing updates on the final testing and development progress.
column15:
>https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC_bXAqtExCIQSsozIBwJLbA

Please join our vision, and support our work, as we strive toward providing the best possible Linux experience for all consumers, with a portable, powerful, and useful tablet now, and more devices in the future.

Risks &
column16:
Challenges:

1.  Failed past Linux/Ubuntu Projects - We totally understand everyone’s apprehensions since the Jolla and Ubutab incidents and the fact it has made everyone very cautious is something we take very seriously here at MJ Technology.

Jolla just needed to be upfront: the money and development focus was on the Sailfish OS and the hardware was an afterthought, not a priority for their campaign here on Indiegogo.

Ubutab on the other hand there were telling signs: nothing but rendered pictures, no plan stated on how to market or sell the tablet (at a profit) as the hardware used would cost more than they were asking for it, which meant no future development and no support after the campaign was done.

Finally the biggest problem was the people involved in making the campaign did not have any experience designing or manufacturing a small scale or mass-produced product, and the campaign was led by a person with no technology field experience or manufacturing background.

We developed and have brought to market one device already, the MJ7HDTV Android HDTV Tuner tablet. We are close to 95% or better complete with the new Linux tablets, and just need funds to make the production of them happen.

The MJ Technology Warrior Tablet Series is based on existing hardware, not something developed from scratch, like a new processor type or something like that. The hardware is based on proven components, and we are assembling them using standard practices.

The unique thing is the OS, which is based on existing software openSUSE which we have developed to work with the hardware we have built. So we are bringing a new product to market, but using proven software and hardware, plus we have a proven track record of delivering the expected product like our MJ7HDTV Tablet.

Our development team has the knowledge and the desire to complete this project. If you look at our progress updates and videos on our Facebook page, you will see we have had the option to try and raise the money for some time. We chose not to do this until we had a proven hardware/software configuration finalized and were ready to take the last steps to move to the production phase.

That time is NOW! Please show your support, whether it is making a pledge for one of our tablets or just spreading the word to others who might be interested via social media or word of mouth.  Let’s make a true Linux tablet, created by avid users, available for everyone, a reality…

2.  Can we produce the tablet as described? - We have worked on a similar device, our MJ7HDTV Tablet since August 2014 and released it to market in October 2015. This is why we have a complete confidence in our ability to successfully deliver this product.
column17:
>

We could really use your comments, suggestions, concerns about our project the MJ Technology Warrior Tablet Series powered by openSUSE. Please e-mail us @ comments@mj-technology.com  So we can address any and all concerns you might have about project we have not addressed as of yet with videos, pictures, and our mission statement here on IndieGoGo.

We have an experienced team, very skilled both with hardware and software integration. We are absolutely confident that we can ship this MJ Technology Warrior Tablet Series powered by openSUSE according to our projected timeline.  We have already completed and tested several models of the prototype using the old Intel’s Bay Trail Processor when we first started development and now with the Intel Cherry Trail processor.

This has helped us to not only gain thorough, component-specific knowledge to aid in development and design of this tablet, but has allowed us to build solid and professional relationships with all of the component suppliers involved in the future production process.

We understand that there are a few risks associated with the launch of a brand new technology product into the world market, but we are convinced that with our design, these are minimal and manageable. We already have in our hands a complete, functioning product, and we are ready to mass-produce it for you the consumer.

We believe in a transparent project management approach, thus we have chosen to keep all our backers informed on a regular basis about the progress made during the production phase, just as we have during the hardware/software development phase, through our Facebook page.

  https://www.facebook.com/MJ-Technology-LLC-576568032444682/

Mark - Co-founder of MJ Technology the company working on The MJ Technology Warrior series tablet you see here and co-creator of the MJ7HDTV Android HDTV Tuner Tablet. Mark has twenty years in the portable electronics manufacturing hardware/software design and team management. He is also an experienced Linux Developer specializing in Linux driver and kernel development.

Jay - Co-founder of MJ Technology the company working on The MJ Technology Warrior series tablet you see here and co-creator of the MJ7HDTV Android HDTV Tuner Tablet. Jay has twenty years in the portable electronics hardware/software design and team management. He is also the visionary and CTO/President of MJ Technology.

Edmond Wang - CEO of the leading manufacturer of tablets and wearable device in China/USA, which produce more than 2 million tablets annually .More than 20 years working experience in IT industry,  Edmond lead a BIT team to do the OEM/ODM work for the customers more than 30 countries. He brings a wealth of marketing knowledge and management of distribution for the team.

James Mason - James is working hard to make SUSE Linux rock in the public cloud. He's been working on various projects at SUSE since 2010, and has been working with Linux for 14 years. His first distro was SUSE Linux 7.1.

Jason Guo - Electronics Engineer/Designer with 12 years working experience  on intel PCB design, he has worked as senior hardware engineer for Philips and Creative.

Reckon - Engineer/Developer with 20 years’ experience as an Android/Linux developer and electrical engineer for a OEM/ODM Manufacturer. Reckon specializes in Linux Driver/Kernel development and electrical design.

Jon - Experienced Linux Developer specializing in Linux driver and kernel development his focus has been on optimization of the kernel and drivers.

Jon Thomas – Avid Linux User/Fan and head of public relations here at MJ Technology.
column19:
>

Please e-mail us @ comments@mj-technology.com  So we can address any and all concerns you might have about project we have not addressed as of yet with videos, pictures, and our mission statement here on IndieGoGo.We have an experienced team, very skilled both with hardware and software integration. We are absolutely confident that we can ship this MJ Technology Warrior Tablet Series powered by openSUSE according to our projected timeline.  We have already completed and tested several models of the prototype using the old Intel’s Bay Trail Processor when we first started development and now with the Intel Cherry Trail processor.This has helped us to not only gain thorough, component-specific knowledge to aid in development and design of this tablet, but has allowed us to build solid and professional relationships with all of the component suppliers involved in the future production process.We understand that there are a few risks associated with the launch of a brand new technology product into the world market, but we are convinced that with our design, these are minimal and manageable. We already have in our hands a complete, functioning product, and we are ready to mass-produce it for you the consumer.We believe in a transparent project management approach, thus we have chosen to keep all our backers informed on a regular basis about the progress made during the production phase, just as we have during the hardware/software development phase, through our Facebook page.  https://www.facebook.com/MJ-Technology-LLC-576568032444682/Mark - Co-founder of MJ Technology the company working on The MJ Technology Warrior series tablet you see here and co-creator of the MJ7HDTV Android HDTV Tuner Tablet. Mark has twenty years in the portable electronics manufacturing hardware/software design and team management. He is also an experienced Linux Developer specializing in Linux driver and kernel development.Jay - Co-founder of MJ Technology the company working on The MJ Technology Warrior series tablet you see here and co-creator of the MJ7HDTV Android HDTV Tuner Tablet. Jay has twenty years in the portable electronics hardware/software design and team management. He is also the visionary and CTO/President of MJ Technology.Edmond Wang - CEO of the leading manufacturer of tablets and wearable device in China/USA, which produce more than 2 million tablets annually .More than 20 years working experience in IT industry,  Edmond lead a BIT team to do the OEM/ODM work for the customers more than 30 countries. He brings a wealth of marketing knowledge and management of distribution for the team.James Mason - James is working hard to make SUSE Linux rock in the public cloud. He's been working on various projects at SUSE since 2010, and has been working with Linux for 14 years. His first distro was SUSE Linux 7.1.Jason Guo - Electronics Engineer/Designer with 12 years working experience  on intel PCB design, he has worked as senior hardware engineer for Philips and Creative.Reckon - Engineer/Developer with 20 years’ experience as an Android/Linux developer and electrical engineer for a OEM/ODM Manufacturer. Reckon specializes in Linux Driver/Kernel development and electrical design.Jon - Experienced Linux Developer specializing in Linux driver and kernel development his focus has been on optimization of the kernel and drivers.Jon Thomas – Avid Linux User/Fan and head of public relations here at MJ Technology.",23.0,0,"2 Campaigns

It takes very little for malicious people to break your privacy while you are connected to internet. The time to read an email, to post a tweet, check your favourite site and even read this sentence. But now there is a way to protect yourself, it is the SHADOWER. Thanks to it, n

column1: data that leaks during Internet use.

The technicalities behind it!

The SHADOWER is based on a custom high-performance router optimized to run TOR, which is considered the best and most secure way to access the Internet anonymously. It
Internet usage with a device that secures all web traffic, without any software
TOR is about hiding your IP address,
not hiding your traffic content, which is what we all mostly need. Tor is
an acronym for “The Onion Router”. It is so named because it works by wrapping
your Internet access request in several layers of encryption and, then,
sends it through an automatically generated chain of computer nodes in
various locations. At some point, the request is unwrapped and sent
The TOR node that performs the final
unwrapping is called the exit node. The exit node decrypts the packet received
from its sibling on the chain of nodes and receives the full plaintext, request submitting it on the requester's behalf to the intended destination. The
exit node waits for the response, encrypts it, and  will send the
encrypted response back to the requester through the node chain. The TOR client
decrypts the packet from the chain sibling and presents it with a
It is very important to be aware of
the risks of sending plaintext over TOR, but you should really consider
the risks of sending plaintext over non-TOR connections too! When you use TOR
other people on the local network and the ISP cannot see what websites you are
looking at, and the website operators cannot know where you are located. When
you are not using the TOR, your data is unencrypted and third parties are
able to see and tamper with your data. Tor allow you to prevent that!
When is it fully safe to use the
location...no one will know where or who you are. BUT the data being
transferred is not safe, so all data content can be read
column2: it is not as easy as

column1: on direct connection but it can be done, so avoid sending your personal data
when using TOR if NO other secure layer such as https is in use.
router or it can be connected to it. Plug the Shadower into your regular Internet
cable (or router), power it up and that’s it. It will immediately provide
an unprotected wireless network (ShadowerOpen) and, if the Shadower button is
pressed, a protected one (ShadowerNet). In this way, you can decide when you
want to be anonymous online and when not.
It is very simple. All the hard work
is being done by the Shadower in the background without you realizing or
worrying about it. And any device can use it!

WAIT! What about TOR Browser, VPN and similar cheaper devices??

The idea of the Shadower is to use a simple device that attached to or replacing your your router can provide a ""protected"" wifi network. It can be used to hide your location and encrypt all your data not only the one generated by your browser.

Is it the only possibility? No. 

You can consider to use a free TOR browser. But this will only protect the data the browser generates. Any other data your PC or MAC is putting online is not protected.

You could use a VPN or devices that let you go via a VPN ... well, the owner of the service has still full access to your data.

Or you could consider other cheaper TOR devices. Let's be honest, to have a good TOR device, the device itself must be a powerful one ... so beware of who claims otherwise. 

The SHADOWER is the most complete solution and it won't cuts more than any equivalent standard router!

Rates: up to 150 Mbps

Wireless Security: 64/128-bit WEP, WPA/WPA2, WPA-PSK/WPA-PSK2 encryption

PoE: 12V Passive PoE

Certifications:  CE, FCC, RoHS

Security Features: Firewall with
Routing, ShadowMode with Exit Node Country Selection
anonymize people on the Internet are far too complex and time consuming to be
accessible by most users. Your support will help us to make a cheap
plug and play device that is suitable for everyone.
help us finalize its production in a way to keep its price low enough for
most people. And, in doing so, you will get a Shadower at a reduced price!
There is very little risk involved in
this project. We have already gone through two prototyping phases and several Shadower
prototypes are now deployed several locations for daily use.
pledges. If you cannot afford a Shadower, help us to get the word out and make

What about shipping costs?

SHIPPING IS NOT INCLUDED
Refer to the perk description to the
shipping costs to be added manually while submitting your pledge. If you
forget to add it, do not worry!!! We will make sure this can be collected
at contact@shadower.co or via the IndieGoGo platform. We will normally
respond very very quickly (especially via email)!

column1: Bluepin has nothing else but a power button and a micro 5-pin, 3.5MM port for the earphones. It is beautiful, simple and stylish.

column2:
TEAM

PINPOINT DESIGN is a DESIGN-DRIVEN company. We are a professional design group that continuously researches on user-centered design of products, services and environments. Also, we maintain keen connection with our customers, creating designs while providing a chance to become more competitive in the market. We provide various products in depth from customer-oriented market research, design to engineering. Designers who have various experience as their foundation are participating in design sectors such as human element research, industrial design and interaction design. Furthermore, we are working on various areas such as communication, medical devices, industrial equipment, toys, transportation, food and beverage, sports equipment and a lot more. Last year we have successfully launched our Any Shock Air smartphones protective, shock absorbing cases line and received good feedback from customers.

Design Philosophy

Anyone can come up with a beautiful design that will please other people's eyes. We want to create something more than just designs soon to be forgotten, designs that will most likely vaporize after some short time. We'd like to be responsible for creating products that not only please one's eyes, but also bring back good memories, stay deep in one's heart and despite the passing time bring smile to one's face.

How will we use crown funding?

The funds that we will hopefully receive from all those interested in our project will help us to improve the quality of our product, cover some of the production costs and guarantee that all the BLUEPINS you purchase will be able to reach you safely. The funds will also be an undeniable help and serve as a great encouragement in creating our new designs and bringing to life our new ideas and visions.

","Why You Need It?

column1: Which type of earphones are you using as an Apple user living in the wireless world?

Most iPhone users use the earpods provided with the iPhone, while some users who prefer the convenience of wireless would pay considerable thoughts and prices to choose the right product from various types and countless brands of Bluetooth products.
We have created a stylish product that works together with the remote controller on the earpods to operate via Bluetooth connection.
The earpods provided for the Apple users have a built-in microphone and are controlled with three buttons.  The quality and performance of these earphones are also excellent.
Bluepin, when connected to the earpods, can operate the Apple device using the remote controller on the earpods based on the synchronized Bluetooth.
Bluepin has nothing else but a power button and a micro 5-pin, 3.5MM port for the earphones.  It is beautiful, simple and stylish.

We here at Symetium have always believed smartphones could be better, and give us more. That is why we have created the new Symetium Smartphone PC. 

Symetium is much more than your ordinary smartphone - It is so brilliant that it is more like a genius phone! It has all the innovation and technology of a computer, right in the palm of your hand!


Please note: Symetium will come with a single SD card slot which means storage capacity can be increased by an additional 128GB
column10:
/>

One device for Everything – Symetium is the no-compromise

column1:
smartphone PC

*  Up to 256 GB of Storage + SD card slot for 128GB
screens at once in order to stream UI (User Interface) environments to a screen,
so for example if you have a tablet sized screen accessory it would be streaming
itself onto this tablet screen mimicking a tablet. Basically, that means it
works like a monitor. But instead of mirroring the UI from the phone itself, it
streams an entirely separate interface allowing the user to still use the phone
without any interruptions while it's streaming a separate UI environment in the

Wireless Screen Adapter - Allows wireless docking. Symetium features a 1080P 5.0 inch OLED panel for rich vibrant colors and deep blacks. With the feature always on you can access the dock menu even from an idle state simply by swiping from the top or bottom to reveal the “dock” icon.

Docking Station - Symetium is built as a computer featuring a full desktop when docked or connected to an external monitor using the usb 3.0 type c connection. Once connected the device turns into a keyboard and mouse combination, making it possible to use it as a computer even when you don't have a keyboard or mouse nearby.
Keyboard/Mouse Accessory (this is a metal case with a keyboard and mousepad) -  Symetium can not only turn into a computer, it can also be a small computer with the keyboard/mouse case accessory.

SymetiumOS is a UI designed with minimalism and elegance in mind. Not only a mobile operating system, by connecting the Symetium device via USB 3.0 type C port to an HDMI screen, you can activate a mouse and keyboard friendly PC mode.

Connecting a mouse lets you control the UI using a cursor. Once connected in PC mode the Symetium device can be used as a mouse or keyboard, eliminating the need for external components if none are available. SymetiumOS has been designed to be used in both landscape and portrait modes.

Unlike stock android, Symetium OS will organize apps and files in individual categories – for example, a gallery of pictures, as well as apps relating to pictures. This was done to keep apps and data clean and organized, and to give the user more control the way a PC operating system does.

This makes the app drawer into a file explorer, merging the mobile experience with the PC experience. There is also a native file explorer accessed by pressing the hard drive icon, the same as for a PC operating system. A switch to revert to stock Android is also planned.
smartphone makers have given us, we here at Symetium have always believed they
could do better. We would envision the improvements, so we were never quite
satisfied with the latest technology. That was when our leader started looking
more closely at his PC. Smartphones are great for on the go, but for big tasks
or even some basic stuff, we still turn to our computers. We started asking why
we couldn’t have a smartphone that offered all of the power, technology, and
efficiency as our computers. This thought is what led us down the long road to
creating the Symetium Smartphone PC – a phone and computer all in one small
handheld device. This truly is a cutting edge state-of-the-art smartphone!

We’ve set such a high funding goal for a good reason. Between design, certification and manufacture, the costs of building a new phone of this magnitude are huge. But we have our sights set on delivering the ultimate smartphone PC, with zero compromise on functionality, technology, or quality.
Here is a breakdown of the estimated use of funds with Production tooling and Manufacture with the highest % allocation.
Indiegogo campaign related fees include: 5% IGG platform fees, approx 4% payment processing fees and also campaign marketing and PR related expenses.
The challenges and risks that are ahead of us as we finalize the development and delivery of Symetium are related to manufacturing and logistics.

• There may be variations in the colors based on our transition from the prototypes used in the photos and video to the final manufactured product. Some colour options might not be available if demand for the colour is below factory minimum quantities or due to unavailability of material in that colour.
• There may be changes to the final dimensions or specifications of some of the parts as we optimize the design for mass production.

• There is the possibility that the delivery of the product to our contributors may be delayed due to unforeseen product changes that require additional development time or addition to the scope of our manufacturing timeline.
• There is the possibility that the delivery of the product to our contributors may be delayed due to unforeseen circumstances in international shipping and logistics.

Finally, the very nature of Symetium means the exact component list is fluid until we enter production to ensure we’re picking the absolute best available part at the time. If we are forced to change a major feature or component, it will ONLY be because we have come up with something better and more innovative to replace it with.
If there are any changes to Symetium, we will communicate these changes to our contributors in a timely manner.
Symetium is unlocked for use on almost all networks
Charger, USB Cable,  Quickstarter Guide, User Manual &
mobile networks will support the Symetium?
Yes, as software evolves, updates will be available as and when necessary.

Manufacturing Symetium Smartphones is very costly and we do not want to fall short. We decided that to do things properly and to assure our supporters that they will receive their Symetium, a minimum budget is needed of $1.25M
As our  campaign is Fixed Funding, if we do not reach our funding goal all funds will be refunded automatically to all contributors.

If there are any changes to Symetium, we will communicate these changes to our contributors in a timely manner.
Is the phone locked or unlocked?
Symetium is unlocked for use on almost all networks
Charger, USB Cable,  Quickstarter Guide, User Manual & Headphones
Is there a warranty on Symetium?
mobile networks will support the Symetium?
Symetium will work on most GSM & CDMA networks throughout the world.
Yes, as software evolves, updates will be available as and when necessary.

Manufacturing Symetium Smartphones is very costly and we do not want to fall short. We decided that to do things properly and to assure our supporters that they will receive their Symetium, a minimum budget is needed of $1.25M
As our  campaign is Fixed Funding, if we do not reach our funding goal all funds will be refunded automatically to all contributors.
Please contact us at jonathan@symetium.com",20.0,2,"4 Campaigns

PocketDock is the simple, all-in-one smartphone charging solution that fits in your pocket. It turns your Apple USB charger into a dock to keep your phone off the ground and eliminate the need for messy cords.

column9:
>

PocketDock Modes Lit Up By Three LEDs Integrated Into the Base

column1:
We’ve integrated LEDs with three modes into the base of PocketDock: Charging, Nightlight, and Off. While charging, the LEDs cycle across the face letting you know your device is still charging. When your device is fully charged, the LEDs remain solid. Nightlight mode leaves theLEDs on while plugged in, with or without a device, making PocketDock easy to find, even in the dark. Off mode allows you to keep charging your device without any lights disturbing your sleep. At the end of the campaign, backers will get to choose the color of the LEDs we proceed with.

The Problem

You’re out and about and grab your phone charger to prevent battery drain. Your charger, along with other cords and headphones, ends up in a tangled mess. When you finally get your phone plugged in, it sits on the ground of the coffee shop, bar, or airport, getting dirty or even stepped on. Your phone deserves better.

More Than Just a Charger

While designing PocketDock, we wanted to create something that offered more utility than just a charger. Voilà! PocketDock can be used as a kickstand on the go or plugged in around the house to keep your phone in sight. Dock it in an outlet out of reach from kids, in the bathroom to belt out tunes in the shower, or in your bedroom to double as a nightlight.


Designed Seamlessly With the Apple USB Charger

Good design means reusing existing materials. Apple makes the smallest, safest USB charger available, so we designed a dock to integrate with it … seamlessly. Borrowing from Apple's design cues, we made PocketDock look like something that should have already come with your Apple charger.


(Apple USB Charger Not Included)


PocketDock is constructed of a durable ABS plastic and fused together with ultrasonic welding, providing a dock that is both sleek and sturdy. Available with either a lightning or micro USB adapter, it is compatible with iPhones and Androids. Its design is compatible with most popular phone cases.
column3:
/>


Additional Stability

Each PocketDock will also include spacers that provide additional lateral stability for larger devices.

column1: Each contribution you make comes with our sincerest thanks. Check out the Early Bird perks to get your PocketDock first!

Why We Need Your Help

We’ve already begun investing in PocketDock designs and prototypes to bring the campaign to life. Your backing will help fund the tooling and part testing to make PocketDock a finished product. Additional costs we’re anticipating include government certifications, licensing fees, and meeting manufacturer minimum order quantities.

In the unfortunate event we do not meet our $25,000 goal, we will not keep the funds – all funds will be returned promptly.

We have already received prototypes of PocketDock and are currently working with the manufacturer to finish the tooling. That process should be finished in May, when we will also receive the tool-made samples. From here we will make any adjustments for the final product, which should be mass produced in June. Fulfillment will be handled locally and also by the manufacturer (depending on demand). Orders for Indiegogo backers will be fulfilled in July, beginning with Early Bird backers.

A bit about Cozy Industries

Cozy Industries is a company obsessed with making simple solutions for modern living. Our first product, MagCozy, was a crowdfunded hit and can be found in stores, on Amazon, and in companies like Google, Airbnb and Pinterest. People love them because they save money and time, while preventing headaches. Now we are working on a more ambitious and ubiqituous problem: smartphone charging. And we promise to deliver the solution – The PocketDock™ – on schedule as we did with the MagCozy.


Risks and Challenges

The risks for this project are fairly limited. We are already working with an Apple-approved MFI manufacturer partner to make PocketDock a reality. They have a lot of experience in the manufacturing of lightning accessories and the certification process.

The main challenge will be making sure the quality of PocketDock is superb to give our backers the best possible product, even if that means re-designing components if they don’t live up to expectations. There is also the possibility of delays due to government certifications.

We are currently in the DVT (Development Validation Testing) stage of developing PocketDock. When we move into the tooling and PVT (Production Validation Testing) phase, Ben will be going to the factory to oversee the production in person. This will help to solve problems before they occur and to make sure the quality meets expectations.

We are not strangers to this process because of our MagCozy learnings. Before even beginning the campaign, we determined that this is a very achievable project with clear product goals. We will regularly post updates about where we are in the development process, especially if we run into any delays along the way.


FAQ

column5: >Does PocketDock include the USB wall adapter?
column9: >No. PocketDock attaches to USB adapters, but cannot be plugged into outlets.

column5: >Will PocketDock work with my phone case?
column9: >PocketDock works with most popular phone cases
column10: however, we cannot guarantee that it will work with every phone case.

column5: >Can I get both a Lightning and Micro USB PocketDock with the 2 PocketDocks or Family Pack contribution levels?
column9: >Yes, just indicate which ones and how many of each you would like.

column5: >Can I use my PocketDock with an iPad or Tablet?
column9: >PocketDock is not designed to be used with tablet devices

column5: >Is PocketDock compatible with the 10W Apple USB wall adapter?

GOLE2 is a real mini PC with a nice full aluminum body will be  2 versions:

GOLE2 Windows10, powered by Intel Cherry Trail Z8350, runs Windows10, 4GB RAM, 32GB Flash on board.

GOLE2 Phoenix OS is powered by Allwinner A64, 64bit Quad-core ARM Cortex-A53, runs Phoenix OS, 2GB RAM, 32GB Flash on board.

Both version come with 5 megapixel 90-degree wide angle camera supports Full HD 1080p video conferencing, also comes with easy-plug-in 2.5'' HDD slot supporting up to 1TB built-in HDD storage.

About the 5mega pixel 90degree wide angle camera:

 

With build-in microphone and speakers, Support Full HD video conference with your family or at office:

30fps FHD video conferencing:

The smart clip can cover the camera to protect your security while you dont use it.

With easy-plug-in 2.5'' HDD case, support up to 1TB HDD or SSD by built-in SATA port.

Introducing Phoenix OS for the Allwinner A64 ARM Powered Gole2 version:

Phoenix OS turns Android into a producivity-enabled OS. Optimized for mouse and keyboard control, comes with Windows-like user interface, supports multi-tasking, multi-windows, excel, word, PowerPoint, email etc. Phoenix OS is probably what Google is working on with their rumored Andromeda OS, turning Android OS into something usable for work.

Spec sheet of GOLE2:

More about the design of GOLE2:

Use cases for GOLE2:

1. Use it as PC at office.

2. Connect GOLE2 to projector in a meeting.

3. Connect to big screen by HDMI cable to enjoy millions drama/movie from internet.

4. Play games.

5. HD video conferencing with your friends or family on your big screen HDTV:

Gole is a leading design house and manufacturer of Intel and Allwinner Mini PCs, Intel and Allwinner tablets located in Shenzhen, China. Gole aims to provide affordable qualified PCs and tablets to consumers around the world.

FAQ

1,Why flexible target?

GOLE is a professional Mini PC manufacturer. We already start the mold in August 2016, T1 will finish around middle of October 2016, No matter the fund raising amount, we will complete GOLE2 and ship to all of our backers!

3, When will GOLE2 start shipping?

We already start the tooling on August 2016, It is under the software debugging now.

Mass production will start on end of November, so we will start shipping in December 2016.

 

3, What express service we will use?

All perks are shipped using DHL with fast 4-12days to arrive from Shenzhen China to any country in the world. Notice that your country may charge you an import duty fee, this should be taken care of automatically by DHL when they deliver you the package. 

Some European backers told us DHL will charge import tax at their country, if you prefer slow shipping but tax-free like Singapore Post or EMS please leave msg or email to gole.tech@gmail.com, we will double confirm with you before we ship out the parcels. 

 

Gole's official website:

http://gole.tech

Find GOLE other products on Amazon and Aliexpress:

http://www.amazon.com/shops/AYWQSOVPZWGXQ

http://www.aliexpress.com/store/2173013

ABOUT

Khiron-Sigma, is a start-up based in London, England, founded by me Adnan! I have recently left Microsoft where I headed up a team responsible for  go to market  planning and partnerships for hardware and software products aimed at the media industry.  Before this I spent my formative years at the BBC where I worked as an Hardware/ Broadcast Engineer.

I have experience bringing products to market as well as being fully aware of the struggles of getting a product manufactured having overseen manufacturing in North America, Across Asia &
column2:
Europe.

To assure the success of this campaign we are leading with our flagship product which will be one unit, one colour and one spec. 

The VISION

The UMPC (Ultra Mobile PC) is not a new concept, many of the tech greats have valiantly attempted to create an array of devices such as the Toshiba Libretto, HP Omni book, promising such key selling points such as performance, portability, good design and long battery life.

Unfortunately, technology limitations and the emergence of the tablet has caused today's companies to copy each other and not innovate in this space.  

We believe that it is time for a class defining UMPC to emerge, tablets do not let you create in the same way as a computer does, now that mobile processing is powerful enough to run applications such as photoshop flawlessly without any code change K∑ made the decision to produce and release the KS-PRO at CES2018

Take your world on the go with the KS-PRO Ultra Mobile PC. Complete with an 8.2-inch super AMOLED screen, this device is highly portable yet totally capable. The KS-PRO UMPC uses Qualcomm Snapdragon 835 and runs on Windows 10. In addition, you get 4G LTE connectivity and the ability to run all the apps you need – even Photoshop.

With this seamless integration, the KS-PRO UMPC is a total powerhouse so you can take your work on the go. Best of all, you won’t have to compromise quality or speed. The KS-PRO UMPC features a 12MP camera as well as dual stereo speakers. You get a USB 3.0 port, two USB Type-C ports, Micro SD card slot, and a 3.5mm headphone jack.

Finally, the compact device features a backlit keyboard as well as an ultra-fast fingerprint scanner to keep everything protected.

Freedom to take Anywhere
The KS-PRO features a battery that will last up to 12 hours (dependent on type of usage), Only 640g which will allow you to carry the KS-PRO anywhere.

Full Desktop – When you need it
column3:
>use a USB-C to HDMI connector to replace your desktop, no need to use your phone to run desktop “like” applications when you connect to a monitor, run the desktop applications you want without compromise.

           On the Go
column4: >You’ll be able to use the KS-PRO all day, on planes, trains &amp
column5: automobiles (not while operating any of them of course J) The KS-PRO is a full laptop replacement that perfectly balances power and portability
column7: >From cold start to logged in to windows 10, using the latest SSD technology you will be ready to present in 10 seconds flat, get your finger ready to log in with our ultra fast finger print scanner securely
column10: >The KS-PRO is launching with 3 keyboard variants, Standard US, Korean 106 &amp
column11:
Japanese 108 Keyboards

Display
With the Super AMOLED  @ 2560 x 1440 resolution the KS-PRO  delivers a bright, vibrant image full of details, from editing images to watching Netflix the experience is unmatched in its class of device.

Creating a presentation at a moment’s notice, or editing on the go Microsoft Office apps will look great, and work lag free.

Front Facing Camera

Featuring a 12-megapixel front-facing HD camera and stereo microphone to make Skype calls to friends and family while you're on holiday and have video conferences with your colleagues on the other side of the world.

Form Factor

  • Clamshell UMPC – hybrid cellular laptop 

Finish

  • Gunmetal Grey

Capacity

column1: • 1080p HD video recording (30 fps or 60 fps)

Fingerprint Scanner

  • Fingerprint identity sensor built into the mouse point
• X2 MicroSD slot (supports up to 256GB Micro SD)
• Slot 2: Micro SD slot up to 256 GB storage

FEATURES

Once we are fulfilling orders, we have already built a strategy for expansion.
KS-PRO – The UMPC that has been promised for decades but not delivered until now
KS-EDU – The Ultimate digital companion at a price that will leave no student without
KS-ALL – Optimised full featured UMPC for emerging markets

We truly believe that this device is revolutionary, there has not been a UMPC like it before, your contributions will allow us to bring this product to life and see a new player within the market, one that is focused on building product that our users can be proud to use and carry around.

Our campaign is going to be 100% transparent and updated weekly to clearly show successes as well as our conundrums.

We want every backer to be part of the journey we have ahead, backers will receive exclusive perks and deals on pricing. 

FAQ:
• There is a possibility that specifications might change, chip-sets and components can become scarce or we might feel that there are comparable components which perform in the KS-PRO better.
• We have provided a flat rate for shipping, however remote areas might incur an additional charge, we will be 100% transparent about this.
• If we fall short of our $300K target a full refund will be issued and we will learn from the experience and try again

The Apple Pencil and iPad Pro Companion
A durable case which transforms into a low angle iPad support, Nina's three main features will help you throughout your busy day.
Protect the Apple pencil and its accessories on the go.
Nina holds the Apple pencil, lightning adapter and up to four spare nibs. The pencil and accessories sit in secure compartments and are encased in a hard shell.
The accessories are stored securely and easily removed. The lightning adapter is stored in the centre of the case and to replace a nib, simply use the pencil itself.

Push the lid back and Nina transforms into a sketching support for the iPad Pro, raising the tablet to a comfortable 10° angle.

Nina's soft top and base grip the iPad to the case and anchor it to the desk, creating a secure working platform.

 

Nina holds the iPad in landscape and portrait mode: perfect for sketching, creating art work or simply scrolling through documents. 

 

 

 

Material choice is critical to keeping the pencil and its accessories safe and your iPad stable on the desk. 

The grey components are made from a soft grip TPE. This holds the pencil and accessories in place, as well as anchoring your iPad to the work surface. The white hardshell is made from ABS, giving Nina a strong, durable outer shell.

 Nina's compact dimensions make her perfect for on the go and an unobtrusive addition to your work space.

 

How It All Began

Last year David, a keen product designer, bought an iPad pro and apple pencil. It immediately became a huge part of his creative process but it wasn't long before he realised something was missing. 

He created his own 3D printed case, to take his pencil and its accessories to and from work.
column2:
>Original Working Prototype

David knew there was work to be done but he was definitely onto something. This is where Thomas jumped in and as team they developed this raw idea into a great product. 

Taken from thumbnail sketches to CAD, several prototypes were created and Nina's key features were refined through weeks of user trials. 

Nina's Design has been finely tuned and is ready for the next step to mass production. Check out the prototype gallery for a deeper look into the design and development process. 

Below is our final, fully functional prototype. Say hello, to Nina.

 

 

What Happens Next

 Don't worry, we've got everything planned out.

 A lean but realistic timeline means you should receive your very own Nina mid October.

Nina was designed in the UK and will be manufactured in the UK.

We're keeping all aspects of production local so we can be there every step of the way. Our material suppliers, injection moulders, tool makers and fulfilment house are all based on our home turf in the North West of England. 

Datum Products 

A partnership between two product designers, Datum products is made of David Littlefair and Thomas Pearson. Two great friends, who are ready and excited for the challenges ahead.

If you're a backer or just want more information on Nina and the project please contact us through one of our social media accounts.

If you'd like to talk business please contact us through our email:
info@dtproducts.co.uk

For more information about us and the progress of the project please check out our website: https://www.dtproducts.co.uk/

Big thank you to Dark Skies Media, the beautiful boys who created our video and a shout out to Bharat and Jean!

 

Risks and challenges

The biggest challenge we face is optimizing and perfecting the manufacturing and assembly process to ensure we provide our backers with the highest quality product possible. As with any product development we do not expect everything to work perfectly first time and our timeline allows for unforeseen obstacles in these final stages of development. 

We decided not to compromise quality for a reduced cost and will keep all of our manufacturing in the UK. This means we have been able to meet face to face with our partners and be as prepared as possible for the next stages. It also means we can physically be there to inspect tools, assess production trials and make quick decisions and manufacturing changes if refinement is necessary.

","The Apple Pencil and iPad Pro Companion

column1: A durable case which transforms into a low angle iPad support, Nina's three main features will help you throughout your busy day.
Protect the Apple pencil and its accessories on the go.
Nina holds the Apple pencil, lightning adapter and up to four spare nibs. The pencil and accessories sit in secure compartments and are encased in a hard shell.
The accessories are stored securely and easily removed. The lightning adapter is stored in the centre of the case and to replace a nib, simply use the pencil itself.

Push the lid back and Nina transforms into a sketching support for the iPad Pro, raising the tablet to a comfortable 10° angle.Nina's soft top and base grip the iPad to the case and anchor it to the desk, creating a secure working platform. Nina holds the iPad in landscape and portrait mode: perfect for sketching, creating art work or simply scrolling through documents.    Material choice is critical to keeping the pencil and its accessories safe and your iPad stable on the desk. The grey components are made from a soft grip TPE. This holds the pencil and accessories in place, as well as anchoring your iPad to the work surface. The white hardshell is made from ABS, giving Nina a strong, durable outer shell. Nina's compact dimensions make her perfect for on the go and an unobtrusive addition to your work space. How It All BeganLast year David, a keen product designer, bought an iPad pro and apple pencil. It immediately became a huge part of his creative process but it wasn't long before he realised something was missing. He created his own 3D printed case, to take his pencil and its accessories to and from work.Original Working PrototypeDavid knew there was work to be done but he was definitely onto something. This is where Thomas jumped in and as team they developed this raw idea into a great product. Taken from thumbnail sketches to CAD, several prototypes were created and Nina's key features were refined through weeks of user trials. Nina's Design has been finely tuned and is ready for the next step to mass production. Check out the prototype gallery for a deeper look into the design and development process. Below is our final, fully functional prototype. Say hello, to Nina.  What Happens Next Don't worry, we've got everything planned out. A lean but realistic timeline means you should receive your very own Nina mid October.Nina was designed in the UK and will be manufactured in the UK.We're keeping all aspects of production local so we can be there every step of the way. Our material suppliers, injection moulders, tool makers and fulfilment house are all based on our home turf in the North West of England. Datum Products A partnership between two product designers, Datum products is made of David Littlefair and Thomas Pearson. As with any product development we do not expect everything to work perfectly first time and our timeline allows for unforeseen obstacles in these final stages of development. We decided not to compromise quality for a reduced cost and will keep all of our manufacturing in the UK. It also means we can physically be there to inspect tools, assess production trials and make quick decisions and manufacturing changes if refinement is necessary.",27.0,0,"1 Campaign

This project started as a dream from our founder at Orion Tech Mods, many years ago, and the Moto Mods technology is the ideal platform to build that, and we are fortunate to have Arrow Electronics in our team.

Like you, audiophiles and music lovers, we have a personal collection of high-fidelity (HiFi)/high-definition (HiDef) content and feel frustrated to leave all that behind when we are on the go, and lose to the tyranny of MP3 and other low definition and lossy content.

Unfortunately, as you might know, HiFi/HiDef content requires special equipment to be listened to (high quality DAC and AMP), and portable devices (smartphones specially) usually require wired (USB) accessories for that purpose.

As many other Moto Z owners, we love the idea of being able to snap specific modules to my phone on the go, with no hassle. And my dream is to have a Moto Mod that is capable of delivering pristine DSD64 content with the good and old headphone jack, without downsampling my music library (DSF, DFF and FLAC lossless content).

So, Motorola, Lenovo and Verizon, in partnership with Indiegogo, have invited developers to submit ideas for Moto Mods as part of the ""transform the smartphone challenge"" (https://enterprise.indiegogo.com/motomods/), to which we were selected as one of the finalists and fortunate to be able to bring that original idea to life.

But the electronics need physical stuff to get produced and software to make it run, right? So, prototyping is expensive, specially when we talk about high quality audio components like here. That's why we need your contribution.

Besides your generous open contribution, on the right we are offering other items that are indispensable to every Moto Z owner (and some secret stuff that only the most interested followers will know about). But you can also opt for an Honorable Mention. The decision is yours!
Just in case, if we can't reach the entire goal, don't worry. The money will be still yours. The campaign is set for flexible funding!

As stated by Daniel Guberman, we are trapped in a world of a ""post-fidelity mindset"" (check Ethan Hein's blog post: http://www.ethanhein.com/wp/2012/the-post-fidel...), with the so-called ""treble culture"", where we have to trade audio quality for convenience and variety.
But it doesn't have to be this way.
Inspired by Motorola's vision for the modular phone (check out this video if you haven't done so yet: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pl2Tr5i41rQ)&
column2: nb... ), we can start a new era of technology innovation that can bring us back to high-fidelity audio experience (think about Pink Floyd's Immersion box sets here!).

column1: We are not talking about rocket science here, but we need to bring what we have best in technology today to the palm of our hands, and the Moto Mod platform is great for that because we can now plug-and-play our Mods (no rebooting required).

And we are also not talking about one lonely guy in his apartment dreaming about this stuff. I have the great support from the Indiegogo partners (Arrow Electronics' and Analog Devices engineers) and the audiophile community (we just took a nap, industry!), and finally this amazing crowdfunding platform from Indiegogo. Thank you, guys!
High quality audio requires high quality components and high quality content (think of ""garbage in ->
column2: garbage out""), and components require software to run - drivers, to be specific, THE most significant challenge in the development of integrated hardware and software.

column1: Like any other new technology, the Moto Mods platform are still maturing and innovators must come forward to make it happen, and there are risks and challenges to overcome here.
In my IT experience, I've been working with innovation for 19 years, since the down of the consumer Internet.

And one of my goals with this campaign is to open a channel to discuss what high-fidelity audio should look like in this ""post-fidelity world"" where we can't afford the luxury of seating in a couch to listen to great music anymore. We need to build a way to bring back the experience of listening to music, to be able to discover new subtleties and even imperfections recorded in that moment of inspiration of exceptional musicians.
Even if you can't contribute with money, your act of sharing this idea with other kindred spirits that are eager to get HiFi audio while on the go.
And don't forget to click on the follow icon to keep updated - and to use the Indiegogo social network sharing tools to spread the news!
January 25: I just received the news that I have been selected as a finalist in Motorola's ""Transform the Smartphone"" Challenge
February 10: Today I received my first audio board for prototyping. I can't wait to start testing it
February 13: Now we are talling. Today I received the Moto Mod Reference and the Moto Z Droid
February 15: Great news. Arrow Electronics is now a supporter of the project. A thank you very much for Paul and his team!
February 16: Today I received my second audio board for prototyping. Now I have to decide on which one to start the development of the drivers
February 17: I got great news from the development community about the drivers. Tomorrow I can start coding it. Thank you Greg!
February 28: The first working prototype is almost complete. After a lot of work, it is time for fine adjustments to integrate with music player apps.
March 1st: Welcome to the Orion Tech Mods team! We are happy to have you Paul and Renata.

March 5th: Jason Bouwmeester at techaeris.com selected us as one of his favorite campaigns to go to ""Round Two: Motorola's Indiegogo “Transform the Smartphone” Moto Mods finalists"": http://techaeris.com/2017/03/03/round-two-motor...

April 19: We have come to the final day of the campaign! Thank you for those that contributed, you made the difference! And check out our Comming Soon page for the second round of the campaign at: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/hifi-audio-m...
And that's all there is for now.
Some Words About the Team & Why a HiFi Moto Mod

This project started as a dream from our founder at Orion Tech Mods, many years ago, and the Moto Mods technology is the ideal platform to build that, and we are fortunate to have Arrow Electronics in our team.

Like you, audiophiles and music lovers, we have a personal collection of high-fidelity (HiFi)/high-definition (HiDef) content and feel frustrated to leave all that behind when we are on the go, and lose to the tyranny of MP3 and other low definition and lossy content.

Unfortunately, as you might know, HiFi/HiDef content requires special equipment to be listened to (high quality DAC and AMP), and portable devices (smartphones specially) usually require wired (USB) accessories for that purpose.

As many other Moto Z owners, we love the idea of being able to snap specific modules to my phone on the go, with no hassle. And my dream is to have a Moto Mod that is capable of delivering pristine DSD64 content with the good and old headphone jack, without downsampling my music library (DSF, DFF and FLAC lossless content).

So, Motorola, Lenovo and Verizon, in partnership with Indiegogo, have invited developers to submit ideas for Moto Mods as part of the ""transform the smartphone challenge"" (https://enterprise.indiegogo.com/motomods/), to which we were selected as one of the finalists and fortunate to be able to bring that original idea to life.
What We Need & What You Get

But the electronics need physical stuff to get produced and software to make it run, right? So, prototyping is expensive, specially when we talk about high quality audio components like here. That's why we need your contribution.

Besides your generous open contribution, on the right we are offering other items that are indispensable to every Moto Z owner (and some secret stuff that only the most interested followers will know about). But you can also opt for an Honorable Mention. The decision is yours!
Just in case, if we can't reach the entire goal, don't worry. The money will be still yours. The campaign is set for flexible funding!

As stated by Daniel Guberman, we are trapped in a world of a ""post-fidelity mindset"" (check Ethan Hein's blog post: http://www.ethanhein.com/wp/2012/the-post-fidel...), with the so-called ""treble culture"", where we have to trade audio quality for convenience and variety.
But it doesn't have to be this way.

Inspired by Motorola's vision for the modular phone (check out this video if you haven't done so yet: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pl2Tr5i41rQ)&nb... ), we can start a new era of technology innovation that can bring us back to high-fidelity audio experience (think about Pink Floyd's Immersion box sets here!).

We are not talking about rocket science here, but we need to bring what we have best in technology today to the palm of our hands, and the Moto Mod platform is great for that because we can now plug-and-play our Mods (no rebooting required).

And we are also not talking about one lonely guy in his apartment dreaming about this stuff. I have the great support from the Indiegogo partners (Arrow Electronics' and Analog Devices engineers) and the audiophile community (we just took a nap, industry!), and finally this amazing crowdfunding platform from Indiegogo. Thank you, guys!

High quality audio requires high quality components and high quality content (think of ""garbage in -> garbage out""), and components require software to run - drivers, to be specific, THE most significant challenge in the development of integrated hardware and software.
Like any other new technology, the Moto Mods platform are still maturing and innovators must come forward to make it happen, and there are risks and challenges to overcome here.
In my IT experience, I've been working with innovation for 19 years, since the down of the consumer Internet.

And one of my goals with this campaign is to open a channel to discuss what high-fidelity audio should look like in this ""post-fidelity world"" where we can't afford the luxury of seating in a couch to listen to great music anymore. We need to build a way to bring back the experience of listening to music, to be able to discover new subtleties and even imperfections recorded in that moment of inspiration of exceptional musicians.
Even if you can't contribute with money, your act of sharing this idea with other kindred spirits that are eager to get HiFi audio while on the go.
And don't forget to click on the follow icon to keep updated - and to use the Indiegogo social network sharing tools to spread the news!
