Not anymore...Introducing HyperJuice - The Most Powerful USB-C Battery Pack USB-C is a new high power (max 100W) connector that can charge virtually any modern device with new laptops, tablets, smartphones switching to USB-C charging everyday and HyperJuice is the most powerful USB-C battery pack because...HyperJuice has not 1 but 2 USB-C plus a 18W QC 3.0 USB-A port HyperJuice delivers the 2 most powerful USB-C Power Delivery 3.0 profiles (100W and 60W) in a single battery pack while the competition struggles to even reach 45W. We also throw in a powerful 18W USB-A Qualcomm Quick Charge 3.0 port for mobile devices. With these 3 powerful fast charging ports, HyperJuice can...Quick charge MacBook Pro, iPad & iPhone all at the same time!Quick charge a large laptop (e.g. 15"" MacBook Pro), a midsize laptop/tablet (13"" MacBook Pro, 12"" MacBook, 12.9"" iPad Pro) and a mobile device (iPad, iPhone) all at the same time!But that's not all, HyperJuice works with any USB-C and USB-A devices and can...Also charge Cameras, GoPros, Headphones, Speakers, VR Headsets, Nintendo Switches and even Drones The only battery that can power the Wacom MobileStudio Pro 16"" The HyperJuice is also the only external battery pack in the world that can power the Wacom MobileStudio Pro 16"" as it requires 100W of power which only the HyperJuice can provide.So how does HyperJuice trash the competition? Check this out, HyperJuice has...More battery capacity and power output in a smaller form factor Almost all USB-C battery packs in the market are underpowered with puny battery capacity or low USB-C power (18/30/45/60W). HyperJuice packs up to 100W USB-C Power Delivery in a single port (up to 130W combined power in all ports) and has the maximum 27000mAh battery capacity allowed on airplanes, yet it is still 28% smaller than the closest competitor.Better Features, Better Specifications and Better Value For Money Charge HyperJuice and your devices at the same time! Recharge HyperJuice from empty to full charge in about 1 hourA huge battery capacity means nothing if it takes forever to charge. You don't want your backup battery to spend more time recharging itself than charging your devices that matter.With its 100W USB-C Power Delivery 3.0 input, it will only take about 1 hour to fully recharge the 100Wh/27000mAh HyperJuice from empty to full.To save your even more time, HyperJuice supports pass through charging so you can charge your devices and HyperJuice at the same time through a single power outlet.Maximum airline safe battery capacity of 27000mAh / 100WhRule the skies with maximum battery capacity approved by TSA/EASA for air travel.  Double the battery life of 15"" MacBook Pro With 100Wh/27000mAh HyperJuice, you can double the battery life of your 15"" MacBook ProUltra portable - only weighs 550gFor all the power, HyperJuice only weighs 550g so you can carry the ONLY battery that matters, that can power ALL your devices, wherever you go, away from the grid, without fear of losing power, without life interrupted.The HyperJuice DesignTo achieve the maximum battery capacity of 27000mAh, we used 8 x LG Chemical 18650 Rechargeable Lithium Ion Battery Cells. We narrowed down to 2 possible battery cell configuration and ultimately went with configuration/prototype #2 as it is slimmer, enough to fit in bags/pockets and easier to grab/hold with a single hand.CAD of 1st prototype with power button, 5 dot LED battery gauge, 1 x USB-C and 2 x USB-ACAD of 2nd prototype with different arrangement of 5 dot LED battery gauge below USB-C port3rd & final prototype with 2 x USB-C, 1 x USB-A and updated 5 stage circular LED battery gaugeEvolution of the side panel and switching the LED lights to brighter white colorDemonstration of working prototypes at CES Consumer Electronics Show Las Vegas in January 2018Demonstration of final working prototype at IFA Berlin in August 2018 prior to coming to KickstarterSlim enough to fit in pockets and easily grab with one hand Minimalist Aircraft Grade Aluminum DesignWhile designing a high capacity battery, we still wanted a highly compact and portable solution. Aircraft grade aluminum was chosen as the enclosure material as it is strong yet thin and malleable enough to follow the lines of the battery cells, wrapping and protecting it with minimal space wastage. Aluminum is also a very good heat dissipator to keep the battery cool at all times. The minimalist aluminum design is efficient, functional and matches the MacBook perfectly.Compliments the MacBook perfectly HyperJuice Ports jam packed with Power!We wanted to be make the most powerful USB-C battery pack so we put in not 1 but 2 high power USB-C ports. We also added a USB-A port so that HyperJuice will be backward compatible with older devices. We ultimately went with more USB-C ports than USB-A ports as USB-C is the future as it is more powerful and more versatile with more devices switching to USB-C everyday. We also designed a unique circular space saving 5 stage LED battery level indicator that lies symmetrically with the power button, just like the ports.Power to charge a MacBook Pro, iPad & iPhone at the same time!Power a 15"" MacBook Pro, iPad Pro and iPhone at the same time! HyperJuice - Designed to be the Most Powerful USB-C BatteryHyperJuice - The Most Powerful USB-C Battery Pack Demonstration of Working Prototype We recently demonstrated a working prototype of the HyperJuice at the recent IFA Berlin 2018 trade show where the following  video was shot.The following one shot unedited video demonstrates a fully functional pre-production HyperJuice with all charging ports working. The 100W USB-C port is shown to charge a 2018 MacBook Pro 15"" at 100W. The 60W USB-C port is shown to charge a 2018 MacBook Pro 13"" at 60W while the 18W USB-A port is shown to simultaneously charge a iPhone X at the same time. Pass through charging is also demonstrated. While HyperJuice is being recharged via its 100W USB-C input port, the HyperJuice is able to charge the 2018 MacBook Pro 13"" and iPhone X at the same time via the 60W USB-C output port and 18W USB-A port respectively. Expected Retail Price

Reward FulfilmentFor US fulfilment, rewards will first be sea freight from our Asia manufacturing facility to our Fremont, California warehouse and thereafter be shipped to US addresses via insured USPS Priority Mail or FedEx Ground. US based backers are expected to receive rewards within a week from shipping from our Fremont, California warehouse. For Rest of the World fulfilment, rewards will be air freight directly from our distribution center in Shenzhen, China. Backers are also expected to receive rewards between 4-20 days from shipping.Project Timeline
November 2018 - Shipping of Early Bird rewards
December 2018 - Shipping of Kickstarter Special rewards

Time to full charge from empty: 1~1.5 hours
Safety Protection: Over current/voltage/temperature, short circuit protection

Our first Kickstarter project, CloudFTP, was the 3rd most funded Kickstarter technology project when funding ended and named by Stuff Magazine as one of the “10 best Kickstarter technology projects”. Our 2nd Kickstarter project, iStick, raised over $1.1 million and was one of the 50 most funded Kickstarter project when funding ended. This is our 15th crowdfunding project. Short Answer: 
iPin is a super cool gadget that turns your iPhone or Android phone into a laser pointer (and wireless presenter).
It's so cool that even Steve Wozniak (co-founder of Apple) carries one by his side.

column3:
>Source: Business Value (China Edition) March 5, 2014 Page 14.

Long Answer:
The original iPin is the world's smallest laser presenter for the iPhone (it works with iPad and iPod touch as well). It is so small, it fits almost completely inside the headphone minijack. Together with the free iPin app, you can wirelessly control presentation slides on your computer right from your phone. No more fumbling for the misplaced laser pointer, wireless presenter and batteries. iPin is the only laser presenter you ever need and it is always by your side, on your phone.

to use iPin by itself to wirelessly control presentations on Mac/PC computers BUT if you are lazy like Pete or just simply don't want to deal with WiFi connections or installing host programs on computers, you would then use BTtogo.

While iPin for iOS/Android alone can perform wireless presentations, some setup is required on the host computer and all devices need to be on the same WiFi network.

BTtogo makes it easier for performing wireless presentations anytime, anywhere, on any public computer, even when there are security firewalls and no WiFi. It's plug-and-play with virtually zero setup.

USB bus powered. No batteries required.

eelo was featured on a number of news sites including:
column3:
>

 

Note about languages: you can turn on subtitles in the presentation video, and you can read the whole story translated in several languages here:

- auf Deutsch 

- en Français

- en Español

- in Italiano
column5:
>

 

In 1998, I created Mandrake Linux, because I was both a Linux fan and didn’t like Windows. It’s been a long time, and I’m very pleased to have been one of the actors who contributed to make the Linux desktop a credible option.

Since then, the smartphone has emerged. And it’s now a “companion of life” for many of us. But I realized this year that I was using an iPhone, a Mac and Google services more and more. I realized that I had become lazy and that my data privacy had vanished.

And I'm definitely not happy with that situation. I’m not happy with this situation because iOS is proprietary and I prefer open-source Software. I'm not happy because Apple is going crazy with their latest products. They are more and more expensive, and not really exciting. 

I’m also not happy with Google and others like them. They have become too big and are tracking us by capturing a lot of information about what we do. They want to know us as much as possible to sell advertising. Like millions of others, I’VE BECOME A PRODUCT OF GOOGLE.

I want to stop that, at least for myself. People are free to do what they want. They can choose to be voluntary slaves. But I do not want this situation for me anymore.
column6:
>

 

I want to reconquer my privacy. My data is MY data. And I want to use Open Source software as much as possible.

But at the same time, the alternatives that exist at the moment don’t exactly fit my needs. First of all, I don’t want to use stock Android: it’s Google everywhere and I don't like its default user interface. There are other initiatives too that fall short of what I'm after. I want something consistent and comfortable to use, like iOS or MacOS are. I want something I could recommend to my parents or my children. And I want something that respects my privacy. 

What I want could be built from existing bricks in a reasonable amount of time and it would come along with nice online tools such as office, cloud storage and email services.
column7:
>

 

This ""new thing"" will be - as much as possible - open source. And for me and others to enjoy using it, it needs to be attractively designed.

At its foundation, it will be forked from LineageOS which is open source and can run mainstream Android applications. On top of that will be layered great open source modules to form a consistent mobile and web system.

I've called the project ""eelo” because eels are small fishes that can hide in the sea. That’s perfect for my quest for more privacy. And we have a nice logo:
column9:
>

 

I want eelo to be a non-profit project, a project “in the public interest”. I strongly believe operating systems and web services should be a shared resource: as I explained a few years ago, they are infrastructure - just like phone networks, rail tracks, and roads.

Non-profit doesn’t mean nothing will be for sale. We envisage selling preloaded eelo smartphones, and providing premium services for corporates. But profit won’t be eelo's primary focus.

And as a community project, eelo will welcome contributors.
column10:
>

 

The eelo project will release attractive-designed ""privacy-enabled"" smartphone ROMs and smartphones for the average user, with associated web-services.

Our first positive results at proof-of-concept stage are  described on this page.
column11:
>

We have also started to review alternative web-services that would be compatible with the eelo project and that we would be able to customize and integrate with the eelo mobile operating system.
column12: >
column13:
>

 

We need to bootstrap the project and pay developers for initial development work to reach a first viable ""privacy-enabled"" eelo product that users will be able to install on their own phones or order on quantity-limited pre-installed eelo smartphones.

This functioning product would include:

- a mobile operating system with new default applications and new user interface

- integrated basic web services (search, cloud storage, settings recovery)

- updates for 3 years or more, with full respect of user privacy. 

Then we will be able to attract more contributors and the project will become naturally sustainable as it iterates to new releases.
column14:
>

 

Between 5% to 10% will go to Indiegogo (service fee &
column15:
financial fees), 60% will be used to pay the development team for a few months until we reach the first minimum viable product, and to pay servers. The remaining 30% will pay all the goodies and services that we offer in return for the user's contributions. Note: 20% VAT may be deducted from the real amount of available money.

- If we reach 100 000 € / $120 000 or more, we'll be able to put more effort into the development team and reach our goal more quickly, and with more first-release features.

- If we reach 500 000 € / $600 000 more, we'll be able to hire more people and set up a full non-profit organization that will be fully operating before the end of 2018. We'll also start to develop a Linux-based eelo operating system for PCs.

- If we reach 1 000 000€ / $1 200 000 or more, we'll be able to do all the above plus quickly gain the status of ""organization in the public interest"". This status will help to attract more money to fuel the project as donations from institutions, states, corporates and individuals will allow some fiscal benefits for donators.

- If we reach 2 000 000€ / $2 400 000 or more, we'll be able to design and release our own eelo smartphone by partnering with a hardware maker, and launch new projects such as a ""voice pod"" home assistant.
column16:
>

And we'll get a great bezel-less eelo smartphone.
column18:
>

Gaël Duval is the project founder, and lives in Europe. Gaël is an open source advocate and has created two significant open source products: the Mandrake Linux distribution and Ulteo, an application and desktop delivery platform.
column19:
>

Hathibelagal Ashraff is eelo's lead developer, and lives in India. Hathibelagal is a programmer, writer, and inventor. His interests include mobile app and ROM development, machine learning, and data mining.
column20:
>

Rhandros Dembicky is eelo's artist in chief, and lives in Brazil. Rhandros is a UI/UX Designer with a solid background in mobile products. For more than 10 years he has worked with big players in the market creating digital products such as PlayKids, one of the world's most famous apps in the kids category.
column21:
>

Véronique Loquet is eelo's head of communication and she lives in Europe. For twenty years Véronique has been helping hackers and IT doers in the open source and security fields to organize their media relations and events, all over the world.

And we're helped by several advisors on various aspects of the project.
column22:
>

 

We think that eelo can have a global, worldwide impact as a major open source project in the public interest. It will help freeing users from personal data spying and advertising. 

eelo is about freedom and privacy in the digital world.
column23:
>

Contributing to this crowdfunding campaign is a great way to support eelo's first stages of development. You are encouraged to share this campaign as much as possible, to friends, on internet forums and on social medias.

You can also register at our website or contact us as a potential contributor. We'll need engineers, testers, translators, and people who can spread the word everywhere.

Find more information about eelo and ways to contact us at eelo.io
column24:
>

 

By contributing to the eelo crowdfunding campaign, you help fuel early development and increase our chances of releasing software and services that will be made available to all. The biggest reward for all of us is the benefits the eelo project can bring to the world. 

But at the same time we have worked on some cool rewards. Depending on your level of commitment, you'll get stickers, t-shirts, and as a eelo official community member, you will be better connected to us and we'll listen to your voice carefully. Last but not least, there will be a few early ""eelo smartphones"" available for the biggest contributors!
column25:
>

 

Since the beginning of the eelo campaign, we have received an awesome amount of support from people who like the project and who want to contribute. We also started to get some media coverage! We hope to soon be in the Washington Post, Elle and Vanity Fair, but meanwhile you can find us on a number of IT news sites, including ZDNet, Wired.it, Slashdot, HackerNoon and AndroidHeadlines.
column26:
>

It’s been a long time, and I’m very pleased to have been one of the actors who contributed to make the Linux desktop a credible option.Since then, the smartphone has emerged. And it’s now a “companion of life” for many of us. But I realized this year that I was using an iPhone, a Mac and Google services more and more. I realized that I had become lazy and that my data privacy had vanished.And I'm definitely not happy with that situation. I’m not happy with this situation because iOS is proprietary and I prefer open-source Software. I'm not happy because Apple is going crazy with their latest products. They are more and more expensive, and not really exciting. I’m also not happy with Google and others like them. They have become too big and are tracking us by capturing a lot of information about what we do. They want to know us as much as possible to sell advertising. Like millions of others, I’VE BECOME A PRODUCT OF GOOGLE.I want to stop that, at least for myself. People are free to do what they want. They can choose to be voluntary slaves. But I do not want this situation for me anymore.   I want to reconquer my privacy. My data is MY data. And I want to use Open Source software as much as possible.But at the same time, the alternatives that exist at the moment don’t exactly fit my needs. First of all, I don’t want to use stock Android: it’s Google everywhere and I don't like its default user interface. There are other initiatives too that fall short of what I'm after. I want something consistent and comfortable to use, like iOS or MacOS are. I want something I could recommend to my parents or my children. And I want something that respects my privacy. What I want could be built from existing bricks in a reasonable amount of time and it would come along with nice online tools such as office, cloud storage and email services.  This ""new thing"" will be - as much as possible - open source. And for me and others to enjoy using it, it needs to be attractively designed.At its foundation, it will be forked from LineageOS which is open source and can run mainstream Android applications. On top of that will be layered great open source modules to form a consistent mobile and web system.I've called the project ""eelo” because eels are small fishes that can hide in the sea. That’s perfect for my quest for more privacy. And we have a nice logo:    I want eelo to be a non-profit project, a project “in the public interest”. I strongly believe operating systems and web services should be a shared resource: as I explained a few years ago, they are infrastructure - just like phone networks, rail tracks, and roads.Non-profit doesn’t mean nothing will be for sale. We envisage selling preloaded eelo smartphones, and providing premium services for corporates. But profit won’t be eelo's primary focus.And as a community project, eelo will welcome contributors.  The eelo project will release attractive-designed ""privacy-enabled"" smartphone ROMs and smartphones for the average user, with associated web-services.Our first positive results at proof-of-concept stage are  described on this page.First eelo prototype smartphone OSWe have also started to review alternative web-services that would be compatible with the eelo project and that we would be able to customize and integrate with the eelo mobile operating system. eelo vision: devices and web services with privacy respect  We need to bootstrap the project and pay developers for initial development work to reach a first viable ""privacy-enabled"" eelo product that users will be able to install on their own phones or order on quantity-limited pre-installed eelo smartphones.This functioning product would include:- a mobile operating system with new default applications and new user interface- integrated basic web services (search, cloud storage, settings recovery)- updates for 3 years or more, with full respect of user privacy. Then we will be able to attract more contributors and the project will become naturally sustainable as it iterates to new releases.  Between 5% to 10% will go to Indiegogo (service fee & financial fees), 60% will be used to pay the development team for a few months until we reach the first minimum viable product, and to pay servers. The remaining 30% will pay all the goodies and services that we offer in return for the user's contributions. Note: 20% VAT may be deducted from the real amount of available money.- If we reach 100 000 € / $120 000 or more, we'll be able to put more effort into the development team and reach our goal more quickly, and with more first-release features.- If we reach 500 000 € / $600 000 more, we'll be able to hire more people and set up a full non-profit organization that will be fully operating before the end of 2018. We'll also start to develop a Linux-based eelo operating system for PCs.- If we reach 1 000 000€ / $1 200 000 or more, we'll be able to do all the above plus quickly gain the status of ""organization in the public interest"". This status will help to attract more money to fuel the project as donations from institutions, states, corporates and individuals will allow some fiscal benefits for donators.- If we reach 2 000 000€ / $2 400 000 or more, we'll be able to design and release our own eelo smartphone by partnering with a hardware maker, and launch new projects such as a ""voice pod"" home assistant.And we'll get a great bezel-less eelo smartphone. Gaël Duval is the project founder, and lives in Europe. Gaël is an open source advocate and has created two significant open source products: the Mandrake Linux distribution and Ulteo, an application and desktop delivery platform. Hathibelagal Ashraff is eelo's lead developer, and lives in India. Hathibelagal is a programmer, writer, and inventor. His interests include mobile app and ROM development, machine learning, and data mining. Rhandros Dembicky is eelo's artist in chief, and lives in Brazil. Rhandros is a UI/UX Designer with a solid background in mobile products. For more than 10 years he has worked with big players in the market creating digital products such as PlayKids, one of the world's most famous apps in the kids category.Véronique Loquet is eelo's head of communication and she lives in Europe. For twenty years Véronique has been helping hackers and IT doers in the open source and security fields to organize their media relations and events, all over the world.And we're helped by several advisors on various aspects of the project. We think that eelo can have a global, worldwide impact as a major open source project in the public interest. It will help freeing users from personal data spying and advertising. eelo is about freedom and privacy in the digital world.Contributing to this crowdfunding campaign is a great way to support eelo's first stages of development. You are encouraged to share this campaign as much as possible, to friends, on internet forums and on social medias.You can also register at our website or contact us as a potential contributor. We'll need engineers, testers, translators, and people who can spread the word everywhere.Find more information about eelo and ways to contact us at eelo.io By contributing to the eelo crowdfunding campaign, you help fuel early development and increase our chances of releasing software and services that will be made available to all. The biggest reward for all of us is the benefits the eelo project can bring to the world. But at the same time we have worked on some cool rewards. Depending on your level of commitment, you'll get stickers, t-shirts, and as a eelo official community member, you will be better connected to us and we'll listen to your voice carefully. Last but not least, there will be a few early ""eelo smartphones"" available for the biggest contributors!  Since the beginning of the eelo campaign, we have received an awesome amount of support from people who like the project and who want to contribute. We also started to get some media coverage! We hope to soon be in the Washington Post, Elle and Vanity Fair, but meanwhile you can find us on a number of IT news sites, including ZDNet, Wired.it, Slashdot, HackerNoon and AndroidHeadlines.",22.0,0,"1 Campaign

HyperDrive for MacBook is the easiest and most elegant way to expand your MacBook storage with any microSD memory card. It is a plug-and-play microSD memory card adapter that sits completely inside the MacBook SD memory card slot with no protruding parts. The patented design features a MacBook matching aluminum cap that sits flush with the MacBook, yet it is easily removable with just your fingernail (or a credit card if you do not wish to spoil your manicure).
Works with any microSD, microSDHC, microSDXC (including 128GB) memory card with support for high speed Class 10/UHS-I/U1/U3 up to 95MB/s.

Sits completely flushed inside the MacBook SD memory card slot with no protruding parts. Features a Macbook matching aluminum cap that is CNC precision machined, polished and anodized to fit the exact color, shape and size of the MacBook it is designed for.
Patented design features a tiny groove which allows for easy removal with fingernail or credit card.

HyperDrive for MacBook is perfect for expanding your MacBook storage by up to an additional 128GB, which is extra space for your documents, movies, iTunes, iPhoto libraries or Time Machine backups. HyperDrive is a simple, seamless, unobtrusive, upgradeable storage solution for your MacBook.
HyperDrive for MacBook comes in 4 different versions for:

column2: >
column3:
>Overview

MIX GO combines a 45W PD laptop charger and a 5,000 mAh power bank with GaN technology. Easily switch from indoor to outdoor, from the office to the coffee shop, without having to carry multiple chargers.

Image that you’re packing for a business trip. To power a laptop, you need to carry a wall charger. To power your phone on the go, you need a power bank. But packing both can feel like overkill. MIX GO combines both functions into a single space-saving device. And with 45W PD output in charger mode and 5,000mAh in power bank mode, nothing is compromised.
column5:
showinfo=0"">

""This has now become my daily-carry battery and my daily carry adapter."" - Tech Craft on YouTube


""...far more practical than Apple's own included adapter."" - Andrew O'Hara, AppleInsider

 

MIX GO supports up to 45W with USB-C PD (Power Delivery), which means it can quickly charge most USB-C laptops, and it can charge your MacBook or MacBook Air at full speed.

Simultaneous High-Speed Charging for MacBook 12” and iPad.

MIX GO also can charge iPhone 11 / 11 Pro / XS / XR / X / 8 up to 50% in just 30 minutes with a USB-C to Lightning cable, and fully charge a Nintendo Switch in just 2.8 hours.Major advancements are coming to the field of electronics thanks to GaN (Gallium Nitride), a semiconductor material with specific benefits over its predecessors in certain applications. In power converters, GaN semiconductors run at a higher efficiency, produce less heat, and tolerate higher current compared to traditional silicon-based approaches.

With GaN technology, now MIX GO can provide 45W of power in a smaller form factor, with a cooler operating temperature and higher efficiency.

Do you ever worry about your phone running out of juice?  MIX GO’s 5,000mAh capacity can extend phone usage time by up to 20 hours. A full day’s charge is at your fingertips. With ZEN+ Adaptive Charging technology, MIX GO supports up to 15W power output in battery mode, automatically detecting your device and fine-tuning the output. ZEN+ makes MIX GO compatible with Apple smartphones, Android smartphones, tablets and many other electronic devices.

Time for bed. Better plug in your phone, your laptop, and your power bank. But do you have enough USB ports to do all of that? MIX GO features pass-through charging technology, so you can rest easy. Plug MIX GO into the wall, and connect your phone and laptop into MIX GO. Your new favorite charger will handle the rest.

At Zendure, we’re all about the user. The power connector folds in for easy storage. The ridged design makes MIX GO easy to grip and plug into the wall. GaN technology allows MIX GO to be smaller than other laptop chargers, and the high-density internal power cell means allows us to pack a substantial amount of juice in there as well. Whether in a suitcase, a bag, or even your pocket, MIX GO was made for travel.

With a foldable and switchable EU / UK plug adapter (in our Global version), you can travel to over 100 countries and regions with MIX GO worry-free. You can also select an AU plug for MIX GO, available as an add-on.

After tirelessly iterating on the design, we are pleased to announce that we have already begun trial production. So far, everything is developing as planned, on track for our mass production goal. You won’t be waiting long to receive your MIX GO.

Zendure was founded in 2013 by Tom Haflinger and Bryan Liu. Zendure has a portfolio of innovative premium-quality products, including A-Series, the world's first crush-proof external batteries
column6:
and SuperTank (10-Minute Charge Powers Your Phone for a Day), which has brought in over $1,000,000 USD in funding worldwide. Their newest product, SuperMini, is one of the smallest 10,000mAh portable chargers with 18W Power Delivery.

The Pearl is a stylish compact mirror with an integrated battery pack that can charge small USB powered devices. The Pearl's slim and lightweight design makes it extremely portable, fun to use, and the perfect accessory for any occasion. With its 3000mAh capacity, the Pearl can provide ample amount of power to a smartphone as well as many other USB powered devices such as a tablet, speaker, or even a motorized fan! Not only is the Pearl an essential companion for your handbag, it is the perfect holiday gift for anyone!

Features of Pearl

This is our 1st Indiegogo but our 3rd Crowdfunding project. Our most recent Kickstarter project, iStick, raised over $1.1 million in funding. Our first Kickstarter project, CloudFTP was the 3rd highest funded Kickstarter technology project when funding ended and named by Stuff Magazine as one of the “10 best Kickstarter technology projects”. We are also the technology provider for another successful Kickstarter project called CameraMator.

Design

The concept is simple. To reinvent the traditional compact mirror by adding a thin high capacity 3000mAh battery, advanced circuitry and cool features like 3X magnification mirror, LED ring light, LED battery inndicator lights and magnetic closure, all without significantly increasing the weight and bulk of the humble compact mirror.

column1: No project is without their risk and challenges but we try to do our absolute best to minimize them. We felt that we have done all the necessary preliminary work prior to coming to Indiegogo. We are no strangers to battery packs, mobile accessories or even Crowdfunding. Having previously done 2 successful Kickstarter projects “CloudFTP” and “iStick”, each with their unique challenges, we have gathered a lot of experience and learnt a lot to make this Indiegogo project even better. That said, we identify the following as our risks and challenges:

MANUFACTURING: The product shown above is a fully functional prototype. We are currently making the final pre-production model which will be ready around Nov 17. The final pre-production model is the model that will be eventually produced and will incorporate improvements such as brighter, more consistent LED ring light, reinforced hinges amongst other improvements. If the final pre-production model fail to meet our high standards, we might not be able to meet the early bird Christmas shipping deadline. However we never had a battery pack product fail at this stage before and initial reports looks very promising. In any case, we will inform funders of any manufacturing or shipping delays before the project funding ends so funders can decide if they want to wait or not.

FULFILLMENT: While we anticipate no issue with shipping the product in January, delivering the early bird products in the US before Christmas is a small challenge which requires careful coordination, planning and execution. The goods will be delivered via US Postal Service and the deadline for Christmas mailing is December 20. Our plan is to ship out on December 15 to give ourselves some buffer.

SHIPPING TO INTERNATIONAL FUNDERS: We have been shipping batteries internationally, as well as domestically, for several years. There have been recent changes in shipping regulations surrounding lithium cell batteries (and we except more will come). We will work closely with our shipping provider to ensure that all our funders receive their Pearl in a safe and timely manner.

In order to live up to the expectations that we have set for Pearl, we have implemented a strict timeline with our manufacturer. We understand that Indiegogo funders want their Pearl as soon as possible, but we also want the Pearl to be of highest quality and up to our desired specifications.
We are dedicated to our project timeline and will keep you informed on the status of our progress on a regular basis via updates.

column2:
>

One of the most popular portable charger capacities is 10,000mAh. This will generally give you a few days’ worth of mobile phone recharges. But many people go with a smaller capacity because they feel that a typical 10,000mAh charger takes up too much space. That’s where SuperMini comes in.

SuperMini is 30% smaller than a traditional 10,000mAh external battery, so it fits in virtually any bag or pocket. Here’s how we did it. SuperMini uses a type of battery cell called 21700. Each cell provides 5,000mAh of charge capacity, making them 50% more energy dense than the cells used in a typical chargers. It takes just two of these cells to reach 10,000mAh, while most portable chargers use three cells.

SuperMini also supports up to 18W of fast charging capability through both its USB-C port and USB-A port. With up to 18W of Power Delivery (PD), SuperMini can charge iPhone X up to 50% in 30 mins with a USB-C to Lightning cable.  

The USB-C PD port also enables rapid 3- hour recharge performance. A standard external battery may take more than five hours to recharge at 2 amps. Its USB-A port supports ZEN+2.0 with Adaptive Quick Charge, taking advantage of the rapid-charging capabilities of compatible QC 3.0 devices.A well-designed product is worth showing off. SuperMini is available in Black, Silver, and our stunning new Blue Horizon. SuperMini boldly adopted this distinctive blue ombre color which is usually seen on high-end smartphones, but is very rare in portable chargers. It is not only hard to implement on the finished surface, but could also greatly increases the cost of production. We spent several months and tried dozens of colors before finally choosing Blue Horizon. To achieve the best surface color for SuperMini, our designers and project colleagues spent over 500 hours to optimize and test many different surface treatments. We hope you love the result!

With USB-C PD (Power Delivery) technology and 10,000mAh of charge capacity, SuperMini conveniently maintains 1-2 days of mobile power for flagship phones and tablets, and can nearly double the battery life of smaller laptops. SuperMini’s broad compatibility extends to Apple, Samsung Galaxy, Huawei, OnePlus and Nintendo products, to name a few.

*Note: Charging times based on laboratory testing, actual results may vary.

We are sure you will enjoy this new added feature: we’ve made SuperMini compatible with low power devices, including wearables like smart watches and wireless earbuds. Typical portable chargers have a minimum charging threshold above the power needed to charge these devices. SuperMini’s X-Charge Mode disables this threshold.

Check out this demo:
column6:
>To enable X-Charge Mode, press the button two times. The status lights will then continuously move up and down to indicate that X-Charge Mode has been activated.

To turn off X-Charge Mode, press the button two times again. We recommend disabling X-Charge Mode when SuperMini is not in use to conserve the battery.

Let SuperMini save you from a dead battery.

Dozens of new crowdfunding campaigns pop up on Indiegogo everyday, however, traditional crowdfunding campaigns have gotten a bit…dull. We want to break the mold with an interactive take on crowdfunding! We want to create something really different. Backers will be put in the driver's seat for a truly interactive crowdfunding experience. Take a look!

Do you have a great idea for a SuperMini video advertisement? Show us what you’ve got! Send us your idea before August 31st. We’ll select our favorite and turn it into a commercial. Click here to send us your best pitch.

We're also

","One of the most popular portable charger capacities is 10,000mAh. This will generally give you a few days’ worth of mobile phone recharges. But many people go with a smaller capacity because they feel that a typical 10,000mAh charger takes up too much space. That’s where SuperMini comes in.SuperMini is 30% smaller than a traditional 10,000mAh external battery, so it fits in virtually any bag or pocket. Here’s how we did it. SuperMini uses a type of battery cell called 21700. Each cell provides 5,000mAh of charge capacity, making them 50% more energy dense than the cells used in a typical chargers. It takes just two of these cells to reach 10,000mAh, while most portable chargers use three cells.SuperMini also supports up to 18W of fast charging capability through both its USB-C port and USB-A port. With up to 18W of Power Delivery (PD), SuperMini can charge iPhone X up to 50% in 30 mins with a USB-C to Lightning cable.  The USB-C PD port also enables rapid 3- hour recharge performance. A standard external battery may take more than five hours to recharge at 2 amps. Its USB-A port supports ZEN+2.0 with Adaptive Quick Charge, taking advantage of the rapid-charging capabilities of compatible QC 3.0 devices.A well-designed product is worth showing off. SuperMini is available in Black, Silver, and our stunning new Blue Horizon. SuperMini boldly adopted this distinctive blue ombre color which is usually seen on high-end smartphones, but is very rare in portable chargers. It is not only hard to implement on the finished surface, but could also greatly increases the cost of production. We spent several months and tried dozens of colors before finally choosing Blue Horizon. To achieve the best surface color for SuperMini, our designers and project colleagues spent over 500 hours to optimize and test many different surface treatments. We hope you love the result!With USB-C PD (Power Delivery) technology and 10,000mAh of charge capacity, SuperMini conveniently maintains 1-2 days of mobile power for flagship phones and tablets, and can nearly double the battery life of smaller laptops. SuperMini’s broad compatibility extends to Apple, Samsung Galaxy, Huawei, OnePlus and Nintendo products, to name a few.*Note: Charging times based on laboratory testing, actual results may vary.We are sure you will enjoy this new added feature: we’ve made SuperMini compatible with low power devices, including wearables like smart watches and wireless earbuds. Typical portable chargers have a minimum charging threshold above the power needed to charge these devices. SuperMini’s X-Charge Mode disables this threshold.Check out this demo:To enable X-Charge Mode, press the button two times. The status lights will then continuously move up and down to indicate that X-Charge Mode has been activated.To turn off X-Charge Mode, press the button two times again. From makers of the bestselling GaN Charger

column3: >In 2019, HYPER created the world's first and smallest 100W GaN charger which went on to raise over $3.3M between Kickstarter and Indiegogo, making it the world's most crowdfunded and bestselling GaN charger product. Now from Hyper...

column1: Smaller than a tiny box of mints
More than 20% smaller than the previous model with more power, features &
• HyperJuice 65W with 3 charging ports (2 x USB-C and 1 x USB-A)
• HyperJuice 100W with 4 charging ports (3 x USB-C and 1 x USB-A)
65W charges 3 devices (2 x USB-C, 1 x USB-A)
Quick charge a laptop, tablet, and smartphone all at the same time.
100W charge 4 devices (3 x USB-C, 1 x USB-A)
Quick charge a laptop, tablet, smartphone, and USB device all at the same time.
Bulky chargers can fall off the wall power outlet
With built-in outlet that supports up to 1500W

Rated at 1500W, it can power the most demanding electronics and appliances. HyperJuice uses a power outlet but also gives one back. Easily insert HyperJuice into any situation even when there are no available power outlets.
Gone are the days of running out of available power outlets. HyperJuice does everything from a single outlet.
HyperJuice stacks upon itself and let you power multiple laptops from a single power outlet
Power 4 laptops from a single power outlet and even more...
Stack up to 16 chargers for 1600W of power

HyperJuice Stackable Chargers are rated to pass through 1500W of power so you can stack a total of 16 x 100W chargers to create a 1600W supercharger with 48 x USB-C and 16 x USB-A ports, all over a single power outlet.
Smaller than Anker Atom PD 4 (100W), Apple 96W, Apple 61W &
Powered by the latest Gallium Nitride (Navitas GaNFast) Technology

HyperJuice utilizes the industry-leading Navitas GaNFast NV6125/NV6127 Power IC to miniaturize components normally found in traditional chargers. The new Gallium Nitride semiconductor material allows for power devices that can operate at higher voltages and switching frequency which results in smaller and more efficient chargers.
See the following video to learn more about GaN:

HYPER is the pioneer of delivering 100W of power in a GaN charger and we have been working for almost a year perfecting the circuit design and firmware to fully utilize the Navitas GaNFast NV6125/NV6127 Power IC to bring the HyperJuice charger to fruition.

We want to make the smallest 65W and 100W charger ever so the circuit board and components are laid out in the most compact and space-efficient manner. Only the industry's most efficient components that can deliver the best performance in the smallest of space are used. The dense circuit board is then surrounded by high-density thin heat sinks to aid in heat dissipation. The entire package is then wrapped in a minimalist fire-resistant polycarbonate enclosure to complete the efficient design.

The following single shot unedited video of working prototypes of the HyperJuice 65W and 100W Stackable GaN Chargers demonstrate that even after stacking 3 chargers over a single power outlet, it is able to pass through more than 1600W of power to power a water kettle and each HyperJuice 65W/100W charger is still able to provide the maximum power of 65W and 100W respectively.

column2: >HyperJuice 65W smaller than a tiny box of mints

column1: Protocol: BC1.2, Apple 2.4A, AFC, FCP, SCP, QC2.0/3.0/4.0+, PD2.0/3.0, PPS

column2: >HyperJuice 100W smaller than a box of mints

column1: Protocol: BC1.2, Apple 2.4A, AFC, FCP, SCP, QC2.0/3.0/4.0+, PD2.0/3.0, PPS

In order to simplify Indiegogo reward fulfillment so that we can get all the chargers out to everyone as soon as possible, we are only offering the charger in a special Indiegogo edition BLACK color (see photos below). We love Black and many backers have asked for Black for our previous project because Black color is more stain-resistant in the long run. White color chargers are for illustrative purposes and may be offered later at retail after fulfillment for Indiegogo is completed. Please understand that having multiple color choices, especially for different chargers within the same reward will just complicate and delay the entire Indiegogo fulfillment process. For example, we won't be able to ask for your color choices until after the project ends via a survey which means we cannot accurately prepare the rewards beforehand.
To ensure timely reward delivery, we will ship rewards via insured postal service from our fulfillment and distribution centers in:
• California USA - fulfilling rewards within the United States
From the team that brought you the World's First 100W USB-C battery pack and Kickstarter Most Funded power bank project
(as well as the world's 1st, smallest, and most crowdfunded 100W GaN charger)

HYPER by Sanho Corporation has been making award-winning USB-C products since 2015. We also have a long proven track record of delivering Kickstarter and Indiegogo projects. Our most successful Kickstarter and Indiegogo project, HyperDrive USB-C Hub for MacBook Pro, raised over $3.1 million and is currently the most crowdfunded MacBook and USB-C accessory. Our latest Kickstarter and Indiegogo, HyperJuice 100W GaN Charger, which raised over $3.3 million is the most crowdfunded USB-C charger. The HyperJuice 130W USB-C Battery Pack is the most crowdfunded power bank project on Kickstarter ($1.4M). Our HyperDrive USB-C Hub for iPad Pro is the most crowdfunded iPad accessory ($1.2M) and many more. So we do have a lot of experience with USB-C and Apple products. This is our 26th crowdfunding project. Our previous crowdfunding projects have altogether raised over $14 million and we have delivered to over 140,000 backers.

For Indiegogo, we are only offering the charger in a special Indiegogo edition BLACK color (see photos under Rewards section below). White color chargers are for illustrative purposes and may be offered later at retail after fulfillment for Indiegogo is completed.

We will only be shipping rewards to USA/Canada addresses for this project. We will not offer International (outside USA/Canada) shipping for this project due to unpredictable postal shipping times and costs as a result of COVID-19.

We do not recommend using plug adapters for this charger as plug adapters are generally not rated for 1500W pass-through power and will not support the stacking ability of this charger. As such, we will also not be offering any plug adapters for this charger. This further reinforces our decision not to offer International shipping.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused to our international backers. As an alternative solution, you can get our bestselling, most crowdfunded 100W GaN Charger with free International plug adapters for 30% off here (discount applied at checkout) which will more than enough pay for any courier express shipping that is less affected by COVID-19 restrictions. The promo expires on 12/31/2020.

Do also check out our other Indiegogo campaigns: Pearl &

iPin is the final brick of transforming your iPhone into a professional laser presenter. It is delicately engineered to be small, and so small that it fits just right inside the headphone minijack. With downloadable iPin app support, it allows you to control presentation slides straight from your phone. No more fumbling for new batteries or misplaced laser pointer. iPin is ready to use anytime, anywhere. iPin – makes your phone shines brighter than ever!

Important! Not compatible with iOS devices purchased in Europe or following EU regulations. Also not compatible with all versions of iPhone 6 Plus (due to variation of power supply in audio minijack). iPin is compatible with all other models of iPad, iPod touch and iPhone (including iPhone 6) that are not purchased in Europe.

Your iPhone is quite enough to perform everything a professional presenter can do, but it is missing just that one little thing: a laser beam. iPin delivers the full package! iPin laser is made so small that it fits perfectly inside the 3.5mm headphone minijack of your iPhone. Just plug it in, and your iPhone is immediately equipped with a high brightness 635nm laser beam!
Stays plugged in even for incoming/outgoing calls.

Not only a simple plug-in, iPin can stay inside the headphone minijack without affecting phone functions. With an innovative ON/OFF design, by simply turning the iPin 90 degrees, you can answer incoming calls without removing your iPin. No need to carry an extra device. iPin – lightens your weight.

Handy control of presentations from a distance away WiFi or Bluetooth. With iPin and iPin app, you’re no longer tied to your computer to flip slides. iPin gives you the luxury and freedom to walk and talk. Just be yourself!
*Bluetooth is only recommended for MacBook users.

Ever had trouble finding a laser pointer just when you needed it? And even if you found it in time, the laser pointer was most likely out of power. Using iPin laser, its power consumption is as low as playing a song*. Just as long as your phone is charged, you’re ready to shine, looking chill and professional.
The World's 1st ever laser INSIDE a 3.5mm headphone minijack
An innovative use of headphone minijack. iPin delivers a superior quality laser beam despite its tiny size. Made with delicate engineering and leading-edge design.

Stabilizing laser light in dynamic working environment is a challenge, especially when stored in a tiny space lacking heat dissipater. A common way of dissipating heat is to connect laser to a bulky circuit. In our iPin, there’s no such luxury of circuit space
column2: therefore, we incorporate the ASIC embedded mini laser to overcome potential temperature problem. The mini laser smartly stabilizes light power by itself and is more compact than those used in an ultra slim DVD drive.

column1: Experience the amber red laser at 635nm wavelength. Human eyes are more sensitive to 635nm than the common 655nm wavelength used by typical laser pointers. iPin is equipped with high efficient 635nm laser that shines the brightest laser dot without aggravating eye safety concerns* or power consumption.
* iPin a Class 2 type laser product. Learn more...
Hybrid pin design. Turn it 90 degrees, handy all year round.

iPin is created to be handy all the time. The smartly engineered hybrid pin is designed to allow calls to be answered or dialed out without unplugging the iPin. Simply turn your iPin 90 degrees to switch ON/OFF and talk as usual.
When using a headphone, safely store your iPin in the headphone clip provided. No worry about losing your iPin. It is right there when you need it. Sweet design for your convenience.
Simply connect your iPhone to a Mac or PC using WiFi. Take full control of your presentation in just seconds.

Forget about looking down and finding buttons. Audience is whom you should put your eyes on. iPin app reads your intuitive finger movement to flip pages and shine laser beam. Countdown alarm helps to keep your presentation right in time limit while the auto-dimming backlight helps to save power consumption under presentation mode.
Drag up trackpad to control mouse curser during presentation. It slides and clicks just like a normal mouse. It’s fun

iPin (Standard) - $49 (Regular Bird) / $39 (Early Bird) / $35 (Loyal Backers)
Suitable for iPhone without a case. May not fit some thick cases sold on the market.

iPin (Extended) - $49 (Regular Bird) / $39 (Early Bird) / $35 (Loyal Backers)
Suitable for iPhone cases less than 2mm thick. May not fit all cases on the market.

User's discretion is advised. Not compatible with iOS devices purchased in Europe or following EU regulations. Also not compatible with all versions of iPhone 6 Plus (due to variation of power supply in audio minijack). iPin is compatible with all other models of iPad, iPod touch and iPhone (including iPhone 6) that are not purchased in Europe.

HYPER by Sanho Corporation is the exclusive distributor of iPin in the U.S. We have been making iDevice accessories since 2009 and are no strangers to crowdfunding.  Our most recent Kickstarter project, iStick, raised over $1.1 million in funding. Our first Kickstarter project, CloudFTP was the 3rd highest funded Kickstarter technology project when funding ended and named by Stuff Magazine as one of the “10 best Kickstarter technology projects”. We are also the technology provider for another successful Kickstarter project called CameraMator. We also have 2 other Indiegogo projects, Pearl: Compact Mirror &

The World's 1st ever laser INSIDE a 3.5mm headphone minijack
An innovative use of headphone minijack. iPin delivers a superior quality laser beam despite its tiny size. Made with delicate engineering and leading-edge design.

Stabilizing laser light in dynamic working environment is a challenge, especially when stored in a tiny space lacking heat dissipater. A common way of dissipating heat is to connect laser to a bulky circuit. In our iPin, there’s no such luxury of circuit space
column2: therefore, we incorporate the ASIC embedded mini laser to overcome potential temperature problem. The mini laser smartly stabilizes light power by itself and is more compact than those used in an ultra slim DVD drive.

column1: Experience the amber red laser at 635nm wavelength. Human eyes are more sensitive to 635nm than the common 655nm wavelength used by typical laser pointers. iPin is equipped with high efficient 635nm laser that shines the brightest laser dot without aggravating eye safety concerns* or power consumption.
* iPin a Class 2 type laser product. Learn more...
Hybrid pin design. Turn it 90 degrees, handy all year round.

iPin is created to be handy all the time. The smartly engineered hybrid pin is designed to allow calls to be answered or dialed out without unplugging the iPin. Simply turn your iPin 90 degrees to switch ON/OFF and talk as usual.
When using a headphone, safely store your iPin in the headphone clip provided. No worry about losing your iPin. It is right there when you need it. Sweet design for your convenience.
Simply connect your iPhone to a Mac or PC using WiFi. Take full control of your presentation in just seconds.

Forget about looking down and finding buttons. Audience is whom you should put your eyes on. iPin app reads your intuitive finger movement to flip pages and shine laser beam. Countdown alarm helps to keep your presentation right in time limit while the auto-dimming backlight helps to save power consumption under presentation mode.
Drag up trackpad to control mouse curser during presentation. It slides and clicks just like a normal mouse. It’s fun
iPin (Standard) - $49 (Regular Bird) / $39 (Early Bird) / $35 (Loyal Backers)Suitable for iPhone without a case. May not fit some thick cases sold on the market.
iPin (Extended) - $49 (Regular Bird) / $39 (Early Bird) / $35 (Loyal Backers)Suitable for iPhone cases less than 2mm thick. May not fit all cases on the market.

User's discretion is advised. Not compatible with iOS devices purchased in Europe or following EU regulations. Also not compatible with all versions of iPhone 6 Plus (due to variation of power supply in audio minijack). iPin is compatible with all other models of iPad, iPod touch and iPhone (including iPhone 6) that are not purchased in Europe.

HYPER by Sanho Corporation is the exclusive distributor of iPin in the U.S. We have been making iDevice accessories since 2009 and are no strangers to crowdfunding.  Our most recent Kickstarter project, iStick, raised over $1.1 million in funding. Our first Kickstarter project, CloudFTP was the 3rd highest funded Kickstarter technology project when funding ended and named by Stuff Magazine as one of the “10 best Kickstarter technology projects”. We are also the technology provider for another successful Kickstarter project called CameraMator. Unbox Mopoint 100W GaN Charger

>

Mopoint has spent more than one year design the EE circuit and firmware to fully utilize the PI GaN Power IC to higher efficiency and better reliability of Mopoint 100W. In order to make the smallest 100W charger with high efficiency ever, we design the  circuit board and components in the most compact PCBA layout. Only the industry's most efficient components that can deliver the best performance in the smallest of space are used. The dense circuit board is then surrounded by high-density thin heat sinks to aid in heat dissipation. We also use the AC-DC instead of DC-DC technology to make sure the high efficiency and low temperature.

92% AC/DC Power Efficiency Test

column1:
Mopoint tested with the efficiency of 92%. As shown in the video above, with an input power of 109W, Mopoint is able to output 100W. 100W/109W = 92%.

• To ensure timely reward delivery, we will ship rewards via insured postal service from 2 fulfillment and distribution centers in: California USA Warehouse - fulfilling rewards within the United States. Hong Kong/China Warehouse - fulfilling rewards to the rest of the world.
• How long does it take to ship to our place?

• For US residents, it will take about 7-14 days for standard shipping. For the EU, it will take up to 7-15 days for standard shipping. For HongKong, Japan, Singapore, Korea, Taiwan, China, it will take about 5-9 days. For the other countries, it will take about 7-30 days. Plus another 3-5 days for local delivery to your door by local shipping services.
• Does my shipping cost include import fees (for non-US orders)?

• It does not. Please note, we will do our best to ensure that the import fees are low, but if you are in an area with import fees, please check with your local Customs to see what charges would occur.
• We provide a 12-month warranty on Kickstarter orders, same as retail.

• We have a 30-day return policy. If your Mopoint is defective or a manufacturer error after opening, you can return it for exchange. However, if it is working properly, it cannot be returned once it is opened and used. The Mopoint does have a one year warranty for any issues you experience in the first 12 months.
• Can I buy more than one Mopoint? What about add-ons?
• Yes, you can buy it by changing your pledge mount, please send message to us on Kickstarter to double confirm.

Wherever you go, Pivo follows. Smart Tracking always keeps you in view, so you'll never walk off-screen and ruin another almost-perfect take again.
If you want Pivo to focus on a specific part of the action, simply select your desired target and stay locked-in on the action.
Taking photos and videos is as easy as snapping your fingers, striking a pose, or simply saying 'cheese'.
Take advantage of Pivo's auto-tracking modes while broadcasting live on all your favorite platforms at once. Powered by Restream.
Attack of the clones! Multiply yourself up to 15 times and be as many different versions of you as you want to be, at the same time, in the same picture.
Make your time lapse more dynamic with a silky smooth 360° camera pan.
Freshen up your feed with a post that's half photo and half video.
A simple and easy way to capture the classic before and after effect.
Capture beautiful, seamless panoramas hands-free. Oh, and now you can be in them, too!
Turn your world inside out or make it revolve around you.
Whatever I can do, you can do better. Or maybe it's the other way around. Whatever the case, make sure you capture it in Versus mode.
Whip between two separate events for hilarious before-and-after storytelling.
Perfect for capturing 360° product shots that you can embed and upload to blogs, website, and other social media channels.
Simple, stunning, and professional product showcasing that fits easily into any backpack for perfectly portable, Pivo-sized photo shoots.

Breaking News: SuperHub makes Apple’s new iPad Pro even better.

Apple just released its new iPad Pro this week, and we’re really impressed! It’s a powerful and convenient device for people on the go. And looking at the specs, there’s really no better companion for the new iPad Pro than SuperHub.

Charge Faster

The new iPad Pro has a maximum charging speed of 30W, but the power adapter included with iPad Pro only offers 18W. SuperHub can deliver 30W, meaning it can charge the new iPad Pro in almost half the time compared to the included charger. That’s less time tethered to a wall outlet and more time being productive… or just having fun.
column2:
>

 

Get More Done

On top of that, SuperHub expands the capabilities of the new iPad Pro’s Magic Keyboard. iPad Pro has a USB-C port that can be connected to SuperHub to take advantage of hub capabilities, so you can pass-through charge another USB-C device and connect a USB-A device as well.
column3:
>

A New Perspective

One more thing! Want to hook up an external display? SuperHub’s HDMI port delivers 4K@60Hz video, for twice the resolution and detail compared to 1080p.
column4:
>

Do you know someone who’s got an eye on the new iPad Pro from Apple? Be sure to tell them about SuperHub! And remember, you can get cash for any referrals you generate. Click here to create your referral link and help us spread the word!
column6:
>

SuperHub is a credit card-sized 4-port adapter &
column8: video transfer solution for work, meetings, travel, entertainment and more. Wherever your day takes you, SuperHub lets you do more while carrying less.
column11:
>

As a hybrid power adapter and hub, SuperHub is powerful enough to handle many tasks and compact enough to take anywhere, making your life easier. With cutting edge GaN technology, SuperHub is handy and portable, with a smaller footprint than a credit card.

column1: How Does SuperHub Work with the New iPad Pro?

Keep your iPad Pro powered with 30W Power Delivery at meeting while share a bigger screen with others. SuperHub provides 18W Power Delivery for another phone and a USB-A port to work as a hub if you need.
column2:
>

How Does SuperHub Work with Nintendo Switch

SuperHub provides 30W Power Delivery to charge your Switch at full speed. At the same time, enjoy a 4K resolution through TV mode display!
column4:
>

SuperHub’s three USB ports can power up to three devices simultaneously, from tablets and smartphones to cameras and wearables. Charge more devices in less time, without swapping ports.
column5:
>

With 30W Power Delivery, SuperHub can fast-charge your iPad Pro, Switch, or even a MacBook at full speed, while charging iPhone up to 50% in 30 minutes at the same time. Powered by SuperHub, the 11'' iPad Pro can get two more hours of  charge in just one hour. That’s better than the 18W power adapter that comes with iPad Pro.
column6:
>

Work: 30W Power Delivery + 18W Power Delivery

Master your workflow with simultaneous data sync and hi-speed charging.
column8:
>

Use SuperHub to connect your USB-C laptop, tablet, or phone to your USB-A camera, flash drive, mouse, or keyboard, and HDMI display, TV, projector and more.
column9:
>

Meeting: Power Supply + HUB + HDMI Solution

Keep your devices charged while taking charge of your next presentation.
column10:
>

SuperHub uses USB 3.1 with 5Gbps data transfer, 10 times faster than traditional USB 2.0. You can transfer a movie in seconds. Perfect for anyone who doesn’t like waiting.

column2:
>

Travel: Super High 5Gbps Data Transfer

Even if you really enjoy photography, transferring photos from your camera to your computer probably isn’t the highlight of your day. SuperHub’s high-speed 5Gbps data transfer makes quick work of this task, anywhere. Yes, even without plugging it into the wall first.
column3:
>

SuperHub’s 4K@60Hz HDMI port allows you to connect compatible USB-C devices to a TV or larger display with up to 4K resolution. While similar products are capable of a slower frame rate of 30Hz, SuperHub delivers 60Hz performance. Whether you’re giving a presentation, watching a movie, or gaming, enjoy twice the detail.
column5:
>

Entertainment: A Better Viewing Experience

Watching movies directly on a phone or tablet is far from ideal. Use SuperHub to connect your compatible phone or tablet to a high-resolution display and enjoy up to 4K resolution at 60Hz. Don’t forget the popcorn.

column1:
DeX / PC Mode: Turn Your Samsung Galaxy S20 into a Laptop 

You know those days when you need your laptop but you don’t need your laptop? If your phone supports DeX/PC mode, you can use SuperHub to connect your phone to an external display and keyboard. This feature is compatible with the latest Samsung S20. Leave the laptop at home if it’s not sparking joy today.

column2:
>

Note: This feature is compatible with Samsung Galaxy S10/S20, Note 10/10+ for USB PD charging and DeX mode, Huawei P20/P30, Mate 10/20/30 series for USB PD charging and PC mode.

SuperHub supports two working modes--desktop mode and wall charger mode--to adapt to your needs in any situation.

column7: t=2s"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">Tech Craft
column8:
>

Something has been bugging us for a while. A laptop power brick takes up so much space, but it only does one thing. Sure, we could add more ports to it, but there had to be more. So we began looking at the sort of “everyday carry” situation for people who are most impacted by this unitasking brick: heavy on-the-go laptop users. We wanted to see what kinds of devices and accessories were essential for these users, and figure out if we could deliver a better solution.

That was back in 2018. We spoke with daily laptop users to get an idea of the feature set that would be most useful to them. Then we got to work on figuring out how to deliver that. We knew pretty early on that we’d need to use GaN (gallium nitride) technology to boost SuperHub’s efficiency and make the device as small as possible.

SuperHub uses Power Integrations PowiGaN Technology SC1933C power IC. PowiGaN is Power Integrations’ internally developed gallium nitride (GaN) technology. PowiGaN switches replace the traditional silicon transistors on the primary side of PI’s highly integrated offline flyback switcher ICs, reducing switching losses and enabling chargers, adapters and open frame power supplies that are more efficient, smaller and lighter than silicon alternatives.
column9:
>

Then we started working on mechanical and electronic prototypes, focusing on core functions as well as overall design and user experience. Every aspect of the product, from its dimensions and slip-resistant feet to the spacing between the ridges and the “D” logo status light, have been fine-tuned so we could create a product that is both useful and attractive.
column10:
>

Two years of ideation, consultation, and iteration has brought us to SuperHub, a multi-port power supply, USB hub, and HDMI converter that could hide under a credit card. A product that most users would be happy to carry in place of their laptop’s power brick.
column11:
>

We’ve been eagerly anticipating the launch of SuperHub, and we don’t intend to keep you waiting too long to get your hands on it. We’ve already gone into trial production, which allows us to identify areas for improvement before mass production begins. Those improvements are nearly complete, and we are on track to deliver the earliest reward in May of this year.
column13:
>

To clarify, SuperHub are available with two versions, the NS Edition and the standard version. Please note, the standard version doesn't support Switch in TV mode. Below is the detail comparison of those two versions.
column15: >

column1: In this campaign, you save up to 31% off the expected retail price of SuperHub ($100), but the amount is limited, and this promotion is only available through this campaign. Start pledging now!
column3:
>

SuperHub includes a versatile USB-C to USB-C cable. This cable supports 4K@60Hz video display, 5 Gbps data transfer and up to 60W charging speed (with a 60W power supply), which fully supports all functions of SuperHub and other compatible devices.
column4:
>

SuperHub comes with an AC cable. If you’d rather plug SuperHub directly into the wall, a global adapter kit will be available as an add-on. This global adapter kit includes four regional adapters (US, UK, EU, and AU), which means SuperHub can work in over 200 countries and regions.
column5:
>

Here is the full list of the package contents. Please note accessories are different in two versions.

>

Zendure was founded in 2013 by Tom Haflinger and Bryan Liu. Zendure has a portfolio of innovative premium quality products with over 20,000 backers on Kickstarter, including A-Series, the world's first crush-proof external batteries
column12:
SuperTank, a massive portable charger, which has brought in over $1,000,000 USD in funding worldwide, and SuperMini, a credit card size 10,000mAh portable chargers with 18W Power Delivery. All of our crowdfunding projects are successfully funded and fulfilled. Base on the abundant experience in charging technology and innovation, we launched SuperHub now. We hope this product will be a life-saver for people who are constantly on the go.

 Follow Zendure on Facebook, Instagrm, Twitter and Youtube to get the newest information.

We The People (WTP) is a global consumer goods accelerator platform focusing on marketing successfully crowdfunded innovations. They are the largest physical chain of stores in the world to exclusively support, promote and retail products made possible with the power of crowdfunding. 

SuperHub is being exhibited at the latest WTP store in Westfield Valley Fair Mall. Come and check it out in person!

Add: Westfield Valley Fair Mall, 2855 Stevens Creek Blvd Suite #2601, Santa Clara, CA, USA, 95050
